analyzed: rkang pa rul can gyis mal cha dang stan la mi rji'o zhes bslab pa dag la gus par bya ba bstan pa'i phyir zhabs 'khru bar blta'o //

original: gdan bshams pa la zhes bya ba ni lha la sogs pas bshams pa'o //üîΩsku drang por bsrang ste zhes bya ba ni ha cang yang mi dgu /

analyzed: pa dang nyan par nus kyi gzhan dag gis ni ma yin no zhes spong ba la 'jig rten nan tan bskyed du gzud pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: dus ma yin par dran pa des ni cir yang mi 'gyur gyi /

analyzed: dus su smon lam dran pa ni 'bras bu dang bcas par 'gyur ro //

analyzed: dus su dran pas kyang bcom ldan 'das rtag tu mnyam par gzhag pa nyid du ston pas 'gal ba med do //

analyzed: mang po gsum yan chad der 'dus so zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: 'dus zhes bya ba ni nye ba tsam du zad do //

analyzed: 'dug ces bya ba ni stan la 'dug pa'o //

analyzed: 'jig rten ni phal cher spyir gzhag pa sngon du 'gro ba can gyi bye brag 'jog pas 'jig rten gyi grags pa dang mthun par gnyis ka smos so //

original: gzhan du na ni 'dug go zhes bya ba de tsam kho nas gnyis ka smos par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na ni 'dug go zhes bya ba de tsam kho nas gnyis ka smos par 'gyur ro //

original: gleng gzhi'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad zin to //
analyzed: gleng gzhi'i tshig gi don la sogs pa bshad zin to //
translated: The meaning of the nidƒÅna and so on has been explained.

analyzed: da ni gleng bslang ba dang sangs rgyas kyi gdung rgyun mi 'chad par bya ba brjod par bya'o //

analyzed: shin tu ngo mtshar che bar bstan pa'i phyir lan gnyis su smos so //
translated: It is mentioned twice in order to demonstrate the great wonder.

original: bde bar gshegs pa zhes bya ba ni bod pa'o //
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa zhes bya ba ni bod pa'o //
translated: Sugata is the one who has gone well.

original: bdag med pa gnyis kyi lam nas yang dag par gshegs so //
analyzed: bdag med pa gnyis kyi lam nas yang dag par gshegs so //
translated: He has gone well by the path of the two kinds of selflessness.

original: legs par gshegs pas bde bar gshegs pa ste /
analyzed: legs par gshegs pas bde bar gshegs pa ste /

original: legs par bstod ces bya ba bzhin no //üîΩyang na nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa bag chags dang bcas pa ma lus par spangs te /
analyzed: legs par bstod ces bya ba bzhin no // yang na nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa bag chags dang bcas pa ma lus par spangs te /

original: gshegs pas bde bar gshegs pa ste /
analyzed: gshegs pas bde bar gshegs pa ste /

original: bum pa shin tu gang ba @208b bzhin no //
analyzed: bum pa shin tu gang ba @208b bzhin no //
translated: It is like a completely full vase.

original: yang na phyir mi ldog par gshegs pas bde bar gshegs pa ste /
analyzed: yang na phyir mi ldog par gshegs pas bde bar gshegs pa ste /
translated: Or else, he is the Sugata because he has gone irreversibly.

original: rims nad shin tu byang ba bzhin no //
analyzed: rims nad shin tu byang ba bzhin no //
translated: It is like a complete recovery from an infectious disease.

original: ji snyed pas zhes bya ba ni phan gdags par bya ba'i bye brag ste /
analyzed: ji snyed pas zhes bya ba ni phan gdags par bya ba'i bye brag ste /

analyzed: phan gdags pa gang ji snyed pa de snyed kyis phan gdags pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: As much as there is benefit to be conferred, that much is the benefit conferred.

original: rgyal po la sogs pa dag kyang 'bangs la sogs pa rton pa dag la ci nus kyis rjes su 'dzin na /
analyzed: rgyal po la sogs pa dag kyang 'bangs la sogs pa rton pa dag la ci nus kyis rjes su 'dzin na /
translated: If even kings and so on, who are not compassionate, take care of their subjects and so on, who are dependent on them, to the best of their ability,üîΩhow much more so the Lord, who is compassionate?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis de 'dir ngo mtshar ba ci che snyam du dogs pa la ngo mtshar gyi rgyur /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis de 'dir ngo mtshar ba ci che snyam du dogs pa la ngo mtshar gyi rgyur /
translated: In order to remove the doubt that this is not at all amazing for the Lord, he says

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: the Tathagata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One.

original: dngos po'i de kho na ji lta ba bzhin du gsungs pas de bzhin gshegs pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po'i de kho na ji lta ba bzhin du gsungs pas de bzhin gshegs pa'o //
translated: He is the Tathagata because he has gone thus, in accordance with the reality of things.

original: yang na snga ma dag ji ltar bdag med pa rnam pa gnyis kyi lam nas gshegs te /
analyzed: yang na snga ma dag ji ltar bdag med pa rnam pa gnyis kyi lam nas gshegs te /
translated: Or else, just as the former Buddhas went by the path of the two kinds of selflessness,

analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs pa rnyed pa de ltar /
translated: and attained the abandonment of the obscurations of afflictions and the knowable,

original: 'dir yang gshegs pas de bzhin gshegs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang gshegs pas de bzhin gshegs pa'o //
translated: so he also went thus, and therefore he is the Tathagata.

original: 'jig rten mtha' dag gis mchod par 'os pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: 'jig rten mtha' dag gis mchod par 'os pa'i phyir ram /
translated: Or else, he is the Tathagata because he is worthy of worship by the whole world.

original: dgra nyon mongs pa dag bcom par gyur pas dgra bcom pa'o //
analyzed: dgra nyon mongs pa dag bcom par gyur pas dgra bcom pa'o //
translated: He is an Arhat because he has destroyed the enemy, the afflictions.

original: shes bya mtha' dag yang dag par kun nas thugs su chud pas yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: shes bya mtha' dag yang dag par kun nas thugs su chud pas yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas so //
translated: He is a Perfectly Awakened One because he has fully understood all objects of knowledge.

original: tshig de dag gis ni bcom ldan 'das kyis rang bzhin gyi don mtha' dag phun sum tshogs pa ye shes dang spangs pa yongs su bstan to //
analyzed: tshig de dag gis ni bcom ldan 'das kyis rang bzhin gyi don mtha' dag phun sum tshogs pa ye shes dang spangs pa yongs su bstan to //
translated: By these words, the Blessed One has taught the knowledge and abandonment that are the perfection of all the meanings of the nature.

original: des 'di skad bstan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: des 'di skad bstan par 'gyur te /
translated: This is taught as follows:

original: rgyal po la sogs pa 'bangs la sogs pa la phan 'dogs pa de 'dir ngo mtshar mi che ste /üîΩde dag ni rnyed pa dang bkur sti la sogs pa rang gi don 'dod pas gzhan la phan 'dogs kyi bcom ldan 'das ni de bzhin gshegs te /
analyzed: rgyal po la sogs pa 'bangs la sogs pa la phan 'dogs pa de 'dir ngo mtshar mi che ste / de dag ni rnyed pa dang bkur sti la sogs pa rang gi don 'dod pas gzhan la phan 'dogs kyi bcom ldan 'das ni de bzhin gshegs te /
translated: It is not at all surprising that kings and so on benefit their subjects and so on.

original: dgra bcom zhing yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas nas phun sum tshogs pa mtha' dag brnyes pas gang phan 'dogs pa de dag ni 'dir ngo mtshar yin par bstan to //
analyzed: dgra bcom zhing yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas nas phun sum tshogs pa mtha' dag brnyes pas gang phan 'dogs pa de dag ni 'dir ngo mtshar yin par bstan to //
translated: Because they desire their own benefit, such as wealth and honor, they benefit others. But the Blessed One, having thus gone, having become an Arhat, a Perfectly Awakened One, having attained all perfections, benefits those who are to be benefited. That is taught as the wonder here.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis phan 'dogs pa 'di la ni thugs brtse ba chen po ma gtogs par phan 'dogs pa'i rgyu gzhan ci yang med pas rnam pa 'dis ni bcom ldan 'das thugs brtse ba chen po kho nar ston to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis phan 'dogs pa 'di la ni thugs brtse ba chen po ma gtogs par phan 'dogs pa'i rgyu gzhan ci yang med pas rnam pa 'dis ni bcom ldan 'das thugs brtse ba chen po kho nar ston to //
translated: In this way, the Blessed One is shown to have great compassion alone.

original: phan btags zhes bya ba ni mngon par rdzogs par byang chub ste /
analyzed: phan btags zhes bya ba ni mngon par rdzogs par byang chub ste /
translated: ‚ÄúHelpfulness‚Äù means complete enlightenment.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba'i dus na byang chub sems dpa' dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su smin pa dag sar chud par mdzad pa yin te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis chos kyi 'khor lo bskor ba'i dus na byang chub sems dpa' dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su smin pa dag sar chud par mdzad pa yin te /
translated: When the Blessed One turned the wheel of the Dharma, he caused the roots of goodness of the bodhisattvas to mature and enter the stages.

original: byang chub sems dpa' chos nyid la rab tu 'jog tu gzhug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' chos nyid la rab tu 'jog tu gzhug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He established the bodhisattvas in the reality of the Dharma.

original: @209a * // yongs su gtad pa ni dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su ma smin pa las dang po pa dag phan btags pa de dag nyid la gtad pa ste /
analyzed: @209a * // yongs su gtad pa ni dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su ma smin pa las dang po pa dag phan btags pa de dag nyid la gtad pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúEntrusting‚Äù means that those beginners whose roots of goodness have not matured are entrusted to those very helpful ones.

original: byang chub sems dpa' chos nyid la rab tu 'jog tu gzhug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' chos nyid la rab tu 'jog tu gzhug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He established the bodhisattvas in the reality of the Dharma.

original: nga yongs su mya ngan las 'das par bstan pa ni khyed kyis ci nas de dag yon tan ma thob pa thob par 'gyur ba dang / thob pa dag las yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur ba de ltar gyis shig zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: nga yongs su mya ngan las 'das par bstan pa ni khyed kyis ci nas de dag yon tan ma thob pa thob par 'gyur ba dang / thob pa dag las yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur ba de ltar gyis shig zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The teaching of my complete Nirvana is for the purpose of making you strive for the attainment of the virtues not yet attained, and for the purpose of making you not fall away from the virtues already attained.

original: de ltar phan btags pa dang / yongs su btags pa gnyis kyis sangs rgyas kyi gdung rgyun mi 'chad par yongs su bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar phan btags pa dang / yongs su btags pa gnyis kyis sangs rgyas kyi gdung rgyun mi 'chad par yongs su bstan to //
translated: Thus, by the two, the benefit and the favor, the continuity of the lineage of the Buddha is shown to be uninterrupted.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams la phan 'dogs pa ni rnam pa lngas dam par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams la phan 'dogs pa ni rnam pa lngas dam par rig par bya ste /
translated: The benefit to the bodhisattvas is to be recognized as supreme in five ways:

original: dus dang / khyad par dang / rgya che ba dang / bstan pa dang / khyab pa'o //
analyzed: dus dang / khyad par dang / rgya che ba dang / bstan pa dang / khyab pa'o //
translated: in time, in distinction, in vastness, in teaching, and in pervasiveness.

original: de la dus ni tshe rabs gzhan pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la dus ni tshe rabs gzhan pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The time is in other lives.

original: khyad par ni phyi rol pa dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyis phan 'dogs pa dag pas khyad par du 'phags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par ni phyi rol pa dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyis phan 'dogs pa dag pas khyad par du 'phags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The distinction is that it is superior to the benefits of the outsiders, sravakas, and pratyekabuddhas.

original: rgya che ba ni phan 'dogs pa de dag bla na med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgya che ba ni phan 'dogs pa de dag bla na med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is vast because that benefit is unsurpassed.

original: bstan pa ni gtan du ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bstan pa ni gtan du ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is a teaching because it is eternal.

original: khyab pa ni phan 'dogs pa de bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyud la phan 'dogs par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyab pa ni phan 'dogs pa de bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyud la phan 'dogs par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is pervasive because that benefit is for the benefit of oneself and others.

original: yongs su gtad pa yang rnam pa gsum gyis dam par blta ste /
analyzed: yongs su gtad pa yang rnam pa gsum gyis dam par blta ste /
translated: The entrusting is also considered excellent in three ways:

original: gnas dang chos nyid rab tu 'thob par bya ba dang / bkar gdags pa'o //
analyzed: gnas dang chos nyid rab tu 'thob par bya ba dang / bkar gdags pa'o //
translated: in the support, in the attainment of reality, and in the designation.

original: gnas ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: gnas ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the support?

original: gang gis de dag chud za bar mi 'gyur ba'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen dag la yongs su gtad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gis de dag chud za bar mi 'gyur ba'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen dag la yongs su gtad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the entrusting to spiritual friends who will not let it be lost.

original: chos nyid rab tu thob par bya ba ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: chos nyid rab tu thob par bya ba ji lta bu zhe na /

original: 'on kyang sems can zhes bya ba ni gang de'i ngo bo snyam pa las log pa'i sgra'i don las brtags pa'i ngo bo skal ba 'dra ba zhes grags pa gang yin pa de ni sems can du bsdu'o //

translated: However, the so-called sentient beings are included in the aggregates of form, etc., because they are the essence of the aggregates of form, etc., which are imagined to be the essence of the meaning of the word ‚Äúsentient being,‚Äù which is the opposite of the meaning of the word ‚Äúnon-sentient being.‚Äù

original: des ni mthong ba dang / rnam par brtags pa'i don gcig tu bsdus nas de'i ngo bor sgro btags pa'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po'i bye brag gis bsdus pa dag ste /
analyzed: des ni mthong ba dang / rnam par brtags pa'i don gcig tu bsdus nas de'i ngo bor sgro btags pa'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po'i bye brag gis bsdus pa dag ste /
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúseen‚Äù and ‚Äúimagined‚Äù are combined into one, and because they are imagined to be the essence of that, they are included by the distinction of the aggregates of form, etc.

original: de'i phyir de dag tshe dang ldan pa 'dra bar snang ngo //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag tshe dang ldan pa 'dra bar snang ngo //
translated: Therefore, they appear to be similar to the venerable one.

original: de ltar spyir bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar spyir bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught in a general way,

original: bye brag tu bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bye brag tu bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: in order to teach in a specific way,

original: sgo nga las skyes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: sgo nga las skyes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: he says ‚Äúborn from an egg,‚Äù etc.

original: @211a * // bye brag gi mtshan nyid de yang rab tu dbye ba gsum gyis gsungs te /
analyzed: @211a * // bye brag gi mtshan nyid de yang rab tu dbye ba gsum gyis gsungs te /
translated: And that specific characteristic is taught by three divisions.

original: skye gnas kyi dbye ba las ni sgo nga las skyes pa la sogs pa rnam pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: skye gnas kyi dbye ba las ni sgo nga las skyes pa la sogs pa rnam pa bzhi'o //
translated: By the division of birth, there are four kinds: born from an egg, etc.

original: gnas kyi dbye ba las ni gzugs can dang gzugs can ma yin pa gnas tha dad pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gnas kyi dbye ba las ni gzugs can dang gzugs can ma yin pa gnas tha dad pa'i phyir te /
translated: The classification of realms is due to the difference in realms with form and without form.

original: gzugs can ni 'dod pa dang gzugs na spyod pa rnams so //
analyzed: gzugs can ni 'dod pa dang gzugs na spyod pa rnams so //
translated: Those with form are those of the desire realm and the form realm.

original: gzugs can ma yin pa ni gzugs med pa rnams so //
analyzed: gzugs can ma yin pa ni gzugs med pa rnams so //
translated: Those without form are those of the formless realm.

original: mtshan mar 'dzin pa'i dbye ba las ni /
analyzed: mtshan mar 'dzin pa'i dbye ba las ni /
translated: The classification of the mode of apprehension of signs is due to

original: 'du shes can zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'du shes can zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: those who possess ideation and so on.

original: 'bras bu che ba'i phyogs gcig dang / srid pa'i rtse mor skyes pa'i sems can rnams ma gtogs par thams cad ni 'du shes can no //
analyzed: 'bras bu che ba'i phyogs gcig dang / srid pa'i rtse mor skyes pa'i sems can rnams ma gtogs par thams cad ni 'du shes can no //
translated: All beings except those of the MahƒÅbrahma class and those born in the summit of existence possess ideation.

original: 'bras bu che ba'i phyogs gcig 'du shes med pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu che ba'i phyogs gcig 'du shes med pa'o //
translated: Those of the MahƒÅbrahma class are without ideation.

original: 'di yang mtshan mar 'dzin pa'i dbye bar byas pa nyid de /
analyzed: 'di yang mtshan mar 'dzin pa'i dbye bar byas pa nyid de /
translated: This is also a classification of the mode of apprehension of signs

original: de med pas rab tu phye bas des mtshon pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de med pas rab tu phye bas des mtshon pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are distinguished by the absence of that and it is illustrated by that.

original: srid pa'i rtse mor skyes pa rnams ni 'du shes med 'du shes med min no //
analyzed: srid pa'i rtse mor skyes pa rnams ni 'du shes med 'du shes med min no //
translated: Those born in the summit of existence are neither with ideation nor without ideation.

original: rab tu dbye ba 'di ni blo zhan pa rnams la phan gdags pa'i phyir byas kyi gzhan dag 'phya ba spang ba'i phyir rab tu ma spros so //
analyzed: rab tu dbye ba 'di ni blo zhan pa rnams la phan gdags pa'i phyir byas kyi gzhan dag 'phya ba spang ba'i phyir rab tu ma spros so //
translated: This analysis is made for the sake of helping those of weak intellect; it is not elaborated for the sake of criticizing others.

original: chos thams cad sems can med do zhes bya ba dang / bshad pa 'di mi 'gal bar bstan par sems can gyi khams kun rdzob kyi bden par sems can gyi khams bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: chos thams cad sems can med do zhes bya ba dang / bshad pa 'di mi 'gal bar bstan par sems can gyi khams kun rdzob kyi bden par sems can gyi khams bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show that this explanation does not contradict the statement, ‚ÄúAll things are devoid of sentient beings,‚Äù

original: ji tsam zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: ji tsam zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: he says, ‚Äúto the extent that‚Ä¶‚Äù

original: gdags pas zhes bya ba ni phung po lnga'i bye brag gi bdag nyid du shes pa ste /
analyzed: gdags pas zhes bya ba ni phung po lnga'i bye brag gi bdag nyid du shes pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúDesignation‚Äù means the knowledge of the nature of the five aggregates.

original: mu stegs can gyis yongs su shes par brtags pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mu stegs can gyis yongs su shes par brtags pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It does not mean the knowledge imagined by the heterodox.

original: 'dis ni skur ba'i mtha' spangs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dis ni skur ba'i mtha' spangs pa yin te /
translated: This passage rejects the extreme of nihilism,

original: btags par yod na skur pa mi 'debs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: btags par yod na skur pa mi 'debs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because if something exists as a designation, it cannot be said to be nonexistent.

original: mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings gang la zag pa dang bcas pa'i phung po lhag ma med pa de la de skad ces bya'i nyan thos kyi yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa ni 'dir mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings ma yin te /
analyzed: mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings gang la zag pa dang bcas pa'i phung po lhag ma med pa de la de skad ces bya'i nyan thos kyi yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa ni 'dir mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings ma yin te /
translated: That realm of nonabiding nirvana in which there are no remaining contaminated aggregates is called the realm of nirvana. But the nirvana of the sravakas is not the realm of nirvana here,

original: de ni dman pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni dman pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is inferior.

original: 'bras bu gya nom pa yod bzhin du snying brtse bdag nyid can rnams 'bras bu dman pa don du gnyer ba ni rigs pa dang ldan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu gya nom pa yod bzhin du snying brtse bdag nyid can rnams 'bras bu dman pa don du gnyer ba ni rigs pa dang ldan pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not reasonable that those who have compassion and who have the sublime fruit would seek the inferior fruit.

original: gal te 'bras bu gya nom pa yod kyang thob par byed mi nus pas de ltar don du gnyer ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te 'bras bu gya nom pa yod kyang thob par byed mi nus pas de ltar don du gnyer ro zhe na /
translated: If you say that they seek it because they cannot attain the sublime fruit,

original: khyod kyi lugs ltar na rigs gsum dang rigs med pa yang yod pas 'bras bu dman pa yang thams cad kyis thob par byed mi nus pa nyid do //
analyzed: khyod kyi lugs ltar na rigs gsum dang rigs med pa yang yod pas 'bras bu dman pa yang thams cad kyis thob par byed mi nus pa nyid do //
translated: then, according to your system, there are those of the three lineages and those without lineage, and so no one can attain the inferior fruit.

original: 'on te byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rigs @211b gnyis 'di 'dra ste /
analyzed: 'on te byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi rigs @211b gnyis 'di 'dra ste /
translated: But if the lineage of the bodhisattvas is twofold,

original: gang gi dbang gis ni thugs rje chen po'i shugs kyis non pa dag ni 'di ci nus sam snyam pa dang / sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' gzhan gyi don mdzad pa gzhan dag kyang bzhugs bzhin du 'dir bdag gis don med pa'i smon lam btab pas ci zhig bya snyam pa de lta bu'i rnam par spyod pa rnams spangs te /
analyzed: gang gi dbang gis ni thugs rje chen po'i shugs kyis non pa dag ni 'di ci nus sam snyam pa dang / sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' gzhan gyi don mdzad pa gzhan dag kyang bzhugs bzhin du 'dir bdag gis don med pa'i smon lam btab pas ci zhig bya snyam pa de lta bu'i rnam par spyod pa rnams spangs te /
translated: Those who are overwhelmed by the power of great compassion, who think, What can I do? and who think, What is the point of my making this meaningless aspiration prayer here, when other buddhas and bodhisattvas are already working for the sake of others?

original: gzhan la ltos pa rgyang bsrings shing /
analyzed: gzhan la ltos pa rgyang bsrings shing /
translated: Abandon such thoughts.

original: snying brtse ba chen pos zin pa rnams 'gro ba sdug bsngal gyi me 'bar bas nyen par mthong nas 'di snyam du bdag kho nas bskyab po zhes smon lam 'debs te /
analyzed: snying brtse ba chen pos zin pa rnams 'gro ba sdug bsngal gyi me 'bar bas nyen par mthong nas 'di snyam du bdag kho nas bskyab po zhes smon lam 'debs te /
translated: With great compassion, they see that beings are tormented by the blazing fire of suffering and they think, I alone will protect them and make aspiration prayers.

original: ji skad du /üîΩdka' 'am mi dka' snyam pa yi //
analyzed: ji skad du / dka' 'am mi dka' snyam pa yi //
translated: As it has been said:üîΩAbandoning thoughts of whether it is difficult

original: rnam par rtog pa rnam spangs nas //üîΩ'gro ba 'di ni nyam thag ces //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa rnam spangs nas // 'gro ba 'di ni nyam thag ces //
translated: or not,üîΩyou yourself have declared

original: khyod bdag nyid kyis zhal gyis bzhes //üîΩzhes bshad pa lta bu'o zhe na /
analyzed: khyod bdag nyid kyis zhal gyis bzhes //üîΩzhes bshad pa lta bu'o zhe na /
translated: that these tormented beings are to be saved.

original: gal te de lta na yang bu sdug pa rgyal por smon pa ltar 'thob par bya mi nus pa'i gya nom pa nyid la ci'i phyir smon lam mi gdab /
analyzed: gal te de lta na yang bu sdug pa rgyal por smon pa ltar 'thob par bya mi nus pa'i gya nom pa nyid la ci'i phyir smon lam mi gdab /
translated: But if that is so, why not make a prayer for the most excellent state, even if one cannot attain it, like a son who prays to be a king?

original: gang gi phyir na dman pa kho na don du gnyer bar byed /
analyzed: gang gi phyir na dman pa kho na don du gnyer bar byed /
translated: Why do you strive for the most inferior state?

original: de lta bas na mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa nyid 'dir phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su rigs te /
analyzed: de lta bas na mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa nyid 'dir phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su rigs te /
translated: Therefore, non-abiding nirvana is appropriate here in the realm of nirvana without remainder of aggregates,

original: de la zag pa dang bcas pa'i phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la zag pa dang bcas pa'i phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there are no remaining contaminated aggregates.

original: ci'i phyir mya ngan las 'da' bar bya'o zhes de skad ma gsungs she na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir mya ngan las 'da' bar bya'o zhes de skad ma gsungs she na /
translated: Why did he not say, ‚ÄúI will attain nirvana‚Äù?

original: bsam gtan dang po la sogs pa bsal ba'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po la sogs pa bsal ba'i phyir ro ;
translated: In order to eliminate the first absorption and so on.

original: / de ni bcom ldan 'das kyis sa 'og ma'i nyon mongs pa med pa'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa'i rnam grangs su gsungs so //
analyzed: / de ni bcom ldan 'das kyis sa 'og ma'i nyon mongs pa med pa'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa'i rnam grangs su gsungs so //
translated: The BhagavƒÅn stated that the first absorption and so on are synonyms of nirvana because they are free of the afflictions of lower levels.

original: ci'i phyir phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su zhes ma gsungs she na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su zhes ma gsungs she na /
translated: Why is it not said that they enter the realm of nirvana with a remainder of aggregates?

original: de ni sdug bsngal gyi phung po'i lhag ma ma spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni sdug bsngal gyi phung po'i lhag ma ma spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they have not abandoned the remainder of the mass of suffering.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sems can thams cad yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i bsam pa ni rgyu gsum gyis blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sems can thams cad yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'i bsam pa ni rgyu gsum gyis blta bar bya ste /
translated: The intention of bodhisattvas to cause all sentient beings to attain nirvana should be understood as having three causes.

original: mi khom par skyes pa rnams la dus gzhan du sdod pa dang / mi khom pa'i gnas skabs ni nye bar mtshon pa'i phyir smon par zad kyi der zad pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: mi khom par skyes pa rnams la dus gzhan du sdod pa dang / mi khom pa'i gnas skabs ni nye bar mtshon pa'i phyir smon par zad kyi der zad pa ni ma yin te /
translated: They wish that those born in unfavorable states will remain for a while, because the state of an unfavorable rebirth is an illustration, but not the limit.

original: de na gnas pa la yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de na gnas pa la yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is impossible for one to attain nirvana while remaining in that state.

original: yongs su ma smin pa rnams yongs su smin par bya ba dang / yongs su smin pa rnams rnam par grol bar bya ba ste /
analyzed: yongs su ma smin pa rnams yongs su smin par bya ba dang / yongs su smin pa rnams rnam par grol bar bya ba ste /
translated: They wish to ripen those who are unripened and liberate those who are ripened.

original: des na don gnyer mi nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na don gnyer mi nus pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, they are not incapable of benefiting others.

original: sems can ma lus pa yongs su mya ngan @212a * //
analyzed: sems can ma lus pa yongs su mya ngan @212a * //
translated: All sentient beings without exception are to be brought to nirvana.

original: las 'da' ba'i bsam pa 'dis ni byang chub kyi sems kyi rgya che ba bstan to //
analyzed: las 'da' ba'i bsam pa 'dis ni byang chub kyi sems kyi rgya che ba bstan to //
translated: By this thought of bringing all sentient beings to complete nirvana, the vastness of the thought of awakening is shown.

original: 'dir ji ltar 'dun pa smon lam gnyis kyis gnas par bya ba de yang bstan to //
analyzed: 'dir ji ltar 'dun pa smon lam gnyis kyis gnas par bya ba de yang bstan to //
translated: Here, how one should stand firm by means of aspiration and vow is also shown.

original: da ni ji ltar rnal 'byor la snyoms par 'jug pas ji ltar bsgrub par bya ba de bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni ji ltar rnal 'byor la snyoms par 'jug pas ji ltar bsgrub par bya ba de bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to show how one should practice by means of yoga and meditative concentration,

original: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: he says ‚Äúthus‚Äù and so on.

original: de ltar kun rdzob tu sems can thams cad yongs su mya ngan las 'das kyang byang chub sems dpa' ji ltar don dam par sems can gang yang dmigs par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar kun rdzob tu sems can thams cad yongs su mya ngan las 'das kyang byang chub sems dpa' ji ltar don dam par sems can gang yang dmigs par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, although all sentient beings are brought to complete nirvana on the conventional level, how is it that the bodhisattva does not apprehend any sentient being at all on the ultimate level?

original: de med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya /
analyzed: de med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya /
translated: Because they do not exist.

original: de ltar rnal 'byor la snyoms par 'jug pas so sor brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar rnal 'byor la snyoms par 'jug pas so sor brtag par bya'o //
translated: Thus, one should investigate by means of yoga and meditative concentration.

original: langs nas 'di snyam du don dam par bdag gis sems can gang yang yongs su mya ngan las 'das par gyur pa med do snyam du sems bskyed pa gang yin pa 'dis ni zab pa bstan la /
analyzed: langs nas 'di snyam du don dam par bdag gis sems can gang yang yongs su mya ngan las 'das par gyur pa med do snyam du sems bskyed pa gang yin pa 'dis ni zab pa bstan la /
translated: Having arisen, he thinks, In the ultimate, I have not caused any sentient being to attain nirvana. The generation of this thought shows the profound.

original: don dam pa'i byang chub kyi sems kyang bstan to //
analyzed: don dam pa'i byang chub kyi sems kyang bstan to //
translated: It also shows the ultimate thought of awakening.

original: snga mas ni kun rdzob bo //
analyzed: snga mas ni kun rdzob bo //
translated: The former shows the conventional.

original: da ni g-yeng ba tshar gcod pas 'dir ji ltar sems rab tu gzung bar bya ba de bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni g-yeng ba tshar gcod pas 'dir ji ltar sems rab tu gzung bar bya ba de bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to show how the mind should be thoroughly apprehended here by the one who has conquered distraction,

original: de ci'i slad du zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: he says, For what reason?

original: gal te zhes bya ba ni ji ste zhes bya ba'i don dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba ni ji ste zhes bya ba'i don dang sbyar ro //
translated: If is to be connected with the meaning of how.üîΩIs that one a bodhisattva?

original: 'o na su gang zag la sogs par 'du shes 'jug pa de byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba'am ci na /
analyzed: 'o na su gang zag la sogs par 'du shes 'jug pa de byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba'am ci na /
translated: If so, then who is it that engages in the perception of persons and so on?

original: gang gi phyir sems can smos pa de kho na mdzad snyam du sems shing /
analyzed: gang gi phyir sems can smos pa de kho na mdzad snyam du sems shing /
translated: Thinking that the Blessed One will explain just that,üîΩhe asks, For what reason?

original: yang ci'i slad du zhes zhus pa dang / cig shos kyis kyang mi bya'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: yang ci'i slad du zhes zhus pa dang / cig shos kyis kyang mi bya'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: and the Blessed One says, It should not be so.

original: dgongs pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: dgongs pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The intended meaning is as follows:

original: blo gros ngan pa dag gi yang de ni phung por las gzhan pa nang na bya ba dang / longs spyod bzhi po byed pa'i skyes bu zhig yod par yongs su brtags nas sems can dang srog la sogs pa'i sgrar tha snyad 'dogs pa dang /
analyzed: blo gros ngan pa dag gi yang de ni phung por las gzhan pa nang na bya ba dang / longs spyod bzhi po byed pa'i skyes bu zhig yod par yongs su brtags nas sems can dang srog la sogs pa'i sgrar tha snyad 'dogs pa dang /
translated: Even those of poor intellect, after imagining that person to be different from the aggregates, the agent of the four actions and the experiencer, designate it with the terms sentient being, life, and so on.

original: gang dag yang gang zag brjod du mi rung bar 'dod pa de dag gi yang de ni phung por gtogs pa'i chos dang mtshan nyid mi 'dra bar khas blangs pa'i phyir shugs kyis don gzhan pa kho nar khas blangs pa yin te /
analyzed: gang dag yang gang zag brjod du mi rung bar 'dod pa de dag gi yang de ni phung por gtogs pa'i chos dang mtshan nyid mi 'dra bar khas blangs pa'i phyir shugs kyis don gzhan pa kho nar khas blangs pa yin te /
translated: Also, those who assert that the person is inexpressible, since they accept that it has a different character from the phenomena that comprise the aggregates, they implicitly accept that it is a different object.

original: thams cad kyang brjod du mi rung bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir dngos po ni nam yang brjod du mi rung ba mi srid do //
analyzed: thams cad kyang brjod du mi rung bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir dngos po ni nam yang brjod du mi rung ba mi srid do //
translated: For it is impossible that things are never inexpressible, because it would follow that everything would be inexpressible.

original: de ni sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma med pa'i phyir dang / gnod pa can yang yod pa'i phyir der lta ba'i byang chub sems dpa' ni phyin ci log la mngon par zhen pas phyin ci log kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma med pa'i phyir dang / gnod pa can yang yod pa'i phyir der lta ba'i byang chub sems dpa' ni phyin ci log la mngon par zhen pas phyin ci log kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: Because there is no valid cognition that establishes it, and because there is also a refutation of it, the bodhisattva who views it would be mistaken, because he would be attached to error.

original: gang phyin ci log tu gyur pa de don @212b dam pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: gang phyin ci log tu gyur pa de don @212b dam pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: How could one who is mistaken be a true bodhisattva?

original: gzhan na re bdag sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma yod pa kho na yin nam /
analyzed: gzhan na re bdag sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma yod pa kho na yin nam /
translated: But if you say that there is a valid cognition that establishes the self,

original: 'di ltar bcings pa dang / thar pa dang / lam dang / 'bras bu 'brel ba dang / dran pa dang / ngo shes pa la sogs pa ni gzhi gcig pa grags pa dag yin na /
analyzed: 'di ltar bcings pa dang / thar pa dang / lam dang / 'bras bu 'brel ba dang / dran pa dang / ngo shes pa la sogs pa ni gzhi gcig pa grags pa dag yin na /
translated: then why is it that bondage, liberation, the path, the connection between action and effect, memory, recognition, and so on are well known to be based on a single basis?

original: bdag med par smra ba khyed kyi lugs ltar na de dag gi gzhir 'grub par 'gyur ba gang yin pa gcig pu ni 'ga' yang med na gzhir 'gyur ba gang zhig yin /

analyzed: phrad pa'i skyon du yang 'gyur ro //
