translated: Therefore, there is not the slightest valid cognition that establishes the self.

original: mngon sum du rjes su dpag pa las ma gtogs pa'i tshad ma ni med do zhes phyogs gzhan du dpyad zin to //
analyzed: mngon sum du rjes su dpag pa las ma gtogs pa'i tshad ma ni med do zhes phyogs gzhan du dpyad zin to //
translated: It has already been analyzed in another section that there is no valid cognition other than perception and inference.

original: gnod pa can gyi tshad ma yang bsal ba kho nar dmigs te /
analyzed: gnod pa can gyi tshad ma yang bsal ba kho nar dmigs te /
translated: Moreover, the valid cognition that refutes the self is also clearly perceived.

original: de ltar gal te bdag phung po dag las gzhan ma yin na ni de'i tshe phung po bzhin du skad cig par 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: de ltar gal te bdag phung po dag las gzhan ma yin na ni de'i tshe phung po bzhin du skad cig par 'gyur ba'am /
translated: If the self were not different from the aggregates, then it would be momentary like the aggregates,

original: yang na bdag bzhin du phung po rtag pa dag tu 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang na bdag bzhin du phung po rtag pa dag tu 'gyur te /
translated: or the aggregates would be permanent like the self.

original: de dang tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dang tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it would not be different from them.

original: phung po bzhin du du ma nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba yang bzlog dka' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phung po bzhin du du ma nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba yang bzlog dka' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: It would also be difficult to avoid the consequence that the self would be multiple, like the aggregates.

original: de bas na phung po rnams kho na la bdag ces ming 'dod pa yin te /
analyzed: de bas na phung po rnams kho na la bdag ces ming 'dod pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, the aggregates themselves are accepted as the self,

original: ming la ni brtsad pa med do //
analyzed: ming la ni brtsad pa med do //
translated: but there is no dispute over the name.

original: 'on te phung po bdag dang tha dad par 'don na ni de'i tshe bde ba la sogs pa dang 'brel ba med pas de za ba po la sogs par mi 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on te phung po bdag dang tha dad par 'don na ni de'i tshe bde ba la sogs pa dang 'brel ba med pas de za ba po la sogs par mi 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: But if the self is asserted to be different from the aggregates, then it is not established as the experiencer, etc., because it is not related to pleasure, etc.

original: sbyor ba ni gang zhig bde ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa dang 'brel ba med pa de ni byed pa po 'am za ba po ma yin la /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zhig bde ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa dang 'brel ba med pa de ni byed pa po 'am za ba po ma yin la /
translated: The syllogism is: Whatever is not related to pleasure, pain, etc. is not a creator or an experiencer,üîΩlike a lotus in the sky.

original: grol bar byed pa'am 'khor bar byed pa yin par yang mi rigs te /
analyzed: grol bar byed pa'am 'khor bar byed pa yin par yang mi rigs te /
translated: It is also illogical that it is liberated or that it cycles,

original: dper na mo gsham gyi bu bzhin la /
analyzed: dper na mo gsham gyi bu bzhin la /
translated: like the son of a barren woman.üîΩSince the self also has no connection with action and so on, this is the pervasion.

original: bdag kyang bya ba la sogs pa dang 'brel pa gang yang med pas zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa ni mi dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag kyang bya ba la sogs pa dang 'brel pa gang yang med pas zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa ni mi dmigs pa yin no //
translated: The nonobservation of a pervader is the reason.

original: gtan tshigs ma grub pa nyid kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs ma grub pa nyid kyang ma yin te /
translated: The reason is not unestablished.

original: 'di ltar bde ba la sogs pa dang 'brel pa zhig yin na gzhi dang gnas pa'i mtshan nyid dam /
analyzed: 'di ltar bde ba la sogs pa dang 'brel pa zhig yin na gzhi dang gnas pa'i mtshan nyid dam /
translated: If it were connected with pleasure and so on, it would be characterized as a basis or a location,

original: ldan pa'i mtshan nyid dam /
analyzed: ldan pa'i mtshan nyid dam /
translated: or it would be characterized as possessing them,

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid dam phyogs @214b gsum du 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid dam phyogs @214b gsum du 'gyur grang na /
translated: or it would be characterized as the cause and effect of them.

original: re zhig phyogs dang po ni ma yin te /
analyzed: re zhig phyogs dang po ni ma yin te /
translated: The first possibility is not tenable,

original: ci yang mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ci yang mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it does not perform any function.üîΩIf it were to be posited as a basis because it obstructs the downward movement of water and so on,

original: 'di ltar 'og tu 'gro ba'i chos chu la sogs pa la 'og tu 'gro ba'i gegs byed pas gzhir rnam par gzhag na /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'og tu 'gro ba'i chos chu la sogs pa la 'og tu 'gro ba'i gegs byed pas gzhir rnam par gzhag na /
translated: which are phenomena that move downward,

original: bde ba la sogs pa la ni lus med pas 'og tu 'gro mi srid pa'i phyir bdag ci zhig byed na gzhir 'gyur /
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa la ni lus med pas 'og tu 'gro mi srid pa'i phyir bdag ci zhig byed na gzhir 'gyur /
translated: But since pleasure, etc., have no body, it is impossible for them to go below. So what would the self do to be their basis?

original: gnas par byed pas kyang gzhi ma yin te /
analyzed: gnas par byed pas kyang gzhi ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it a basis because it causes them to endure,

original: gnas pa dang gnas pa po tha mi dad pa'i phyir de nyid byed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gnas pa dang gnas pa po tha mi dad pa'i phyir de nyid byed par 'gyur te /
translated: because it would be the agent of that very action, since the enduring and the endurer are not different.

original: de yang dgag par bya'o //
analyzed: de yang dgag par bya'o //
translated: But that is to be refuted.

original: gnas pa dang tha dad na yang de gnas pa po de la phan 'dogs par byed pa ma yin pa nyid de /
analyzed: gnas pa dang tha dad na yang de gnas pa po de la phan 'dogs par byed pa ma yin pa nyid de /
translated: Even if enduring were different, it would not benefit the endurer,

original: gnas pa don gzhan du gyur pa byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas pa don gzhan du gyur pa byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would be an action that is a different object.

original: de la ni gnas pa bskyed pa'i mthu yang med de /
analyzed: de la ni gnas pa bskyed pa'i mthu yang med de /
translated: And it has no power to generate enduring,

original: thams cad la mthu med par gsal bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad la mthu med par gsal bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is clearly shown to have no power over anything.

original: bdag nyid kyis 'gyur ba'i ngo bo nyid la ni gnas par byed pa gang yang med de /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyis 'gyur ba'i ngo bo nyid la ni gnas par byed pa gang yang med de /
translated: And there is no enduring at all of that which has a nature that changes by itself,

original: de ni gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it endures.

original: de lta ma yin na des de gzhig pa kho nar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na des de gzhig pa kho nar 'gyur te /
translated: Otherwise, it would be destroyed by that,

original: gnas par byas pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gnas par byas pa ni ma yin no //
translated: and it would not be caused to endure.

original: mi 'gyur ba'i ngo bo nyid la yang gnas par byed pas ci zhig bya ste /
analyzed: mi 'gyur ba'i ngo bo nyid la yang gnas par byed pas ci zhig bya ste /
translated: What would be the point of making it abide in an unchanging nature?

original: bdag nyid kyis brtan pa'i ngo bo nyid du gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyis brtan pa'i ngo bo nyid du gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it abides in a stable nature by itself.

original: de lta bas na ci yang mi byed pa'i phyir ldan pa'i 'brel pa yang mi rung ste /
analyzed: de lta bas na ci yang mi byed pa'i phyir ldan pa'i 'brel pa yang mi rung ste /
translated: Thus, because it does nothing, the relation of inherence is also untenable,

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is absurd.

original: de lta na ni thams cad kyang thams cad kyi ldan pa can gyi rgyur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na ni thams cad kyang thams cad kyi ldan pa can gyi rgyur 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were so, then everything would be the cause of the inherence of everything.

original: don gzhan dang don gzhan du ldan par ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: don gzhan dang don gzhan du ldan par ni mi rigs te /
translated: It is not tenable that one thing inheres in another,

original: lcags kyi thur ma bzhin du thams cad bdag nyid gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lcags kyi thur ma bzhin du thams cad bdag nyid gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because, like a metal spoon, everything abides in itself.

original: gzhan yang gal te ldan pa'i stobs kyis bdag bde ba'am sdug bsngal bar gyur na ni de'i tshe ldan pa de gcig pu ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang gal te ldan pa'i stobs kyis bdag bde ba'am sdug bsngal bar gyur na ni de'i tshe ldan pa de gcig pu ste /
translated: Moreover, if the self were to become happy or miserable through the power of inherence, then at that time, that inherence alone,

original: bye brag med pa'i phyir bde ba la sogs pa so sor nges pa'i bdag nyid dang 'brel pa can du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: bye brag med pa'i phyir bde ba la sogs pa so sor nges pa'i bdag nyid dang 'brel pa can du mi 'gyur te /
translated: because it is undifferentiated, would not be related to the self, which is ascertained as individual happiness and so on.

original: de'i phyir bdag gcig pu bde ba la sogs pas kyang thams cad bde ba nyid dam sdug bsngal nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir bdag gcig pu bde ba la sogs pas kyang thams cad bde ba nyid dam sdug bsngal nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, even if the self alone were happy, etc., all would not be happy or suffering.

original: mi mthong ba'i stobs kyis nges pa'i khas len na ni de kho nas nges pa yin na ldan pa yongs su brtags pas ci zhig bya /
analyzed: mi mthong ba'i stobs kyis nges pa'i khas len na ni de kho nas nges pa yin na ldan pa yongs su brtags pas ci zhig bya /
translated: If one were to assert ascertainment by the power of non-perception, then that alone would be ascertainment; what would be the use of postulating possession?

original: de ni gang du yang mthu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni gang du yang mthu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is powerless in any case.

original: 'brel pa can tha dad pas tha dad par 'dogs pa la yang don dam par ni dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin tha dad pa med na /üîΩgang gis rang bzhin tha dad pa @215a * //
analyzed: 'brel pa can tha dad pas tha dad par 'dogs pa la yang don dam par ni dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin tha dad pa med na / gang gis rang bzhin tha dad pa @215a * //
translated: Even if one were to impute difference by the difference of the related, still, if in reality the natures of things are not different,

original: la rag lus pa'i don byed pa'i tha dad par 'gyur /
analyzed: la rag lus pa'i don byed pa'i tha dad par 'gyur /
translated: by what would the difference of the function that depends on difference of nature come about?

original: de lta bas na 'brel ba 'di ni blo gros ngan pas yongs su rtogs pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'brel ba 'di ni blo gros ngan pas yongs su rtogs pa kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, this relation is only a misconception of bad logic.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bus 'brel pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bus 'brel pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is there relation by cause and effect,

original: bde ba la sogs pa rim gyis 'byung bar snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa rim gyis 'byung bar snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because happiness, etc., are seen to arise in sequence.

original: rgyu ma tshang ba med pa can gyi 'bras bu ni res 'ga' 'byung ba'am mi 'byung bar mi rigs te /
analyzed: rgyu ma tshang ba med pa can gyi 'bras bu ni res 'ga' 'byung ba'am mi 'byung bar mi rigs te /
translated: It is not reasonable that an effect which has complete causes sometimes arises and sometimes does not arise,

original: bye brag med pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgzhan dag gis bye brag tu byar mi rung ba'am /
analyzed: bye brag med pa'i phyir ro // gzhan dag gis bye brag tu byar mi rung ba'am /
translated: because there is no difference.üîΩNor is it reasonable that the self, which is not suitable to be differentiated by others,

original: mthu rag ma lus pa can gyi bdag ni gang gis na lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu la ltos nas rim gyis skye bar 'gyur ba lhan cig byed pa la ltos pa ni med do//
analyzed: mthu rag ma lus pa can gyi bdag ni gang gis na lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu la ltos nas rim gyis skye bar 'gyur ba lhan cig byed pa la ltos pa ni med do//
translated: or which has complete power, depends on the assemblage of causes and conditions, because it is not suitable to be differentiated by others, or because it has complete power.

original: des na gal te sdug bsngal skyed pa'i rgyu yin pas de bcings pa yin na ni de'i tshe thams cad du bcings nas rnam par grol bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: des na gal te sdug bsngal skyed pa'i rgyu yin pas de bcings pa yin na ni de'i tshe thams cad du bcings nas rnam par grol bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: If it is bound because it is the cause of the generation of suffering, then at that time it is bound everywhere and is not liberated,

original: rang bzhin rnam pa de lta bu yongs su mi gtong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin rnam pa de lta bu yongs su mi gtong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it does not relinquish that kind of nature.

original: yongs su gtong na ni rtag pa nyid du ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: yongs su gtong na ni rtag pa nyid du ga la 'gyur /
translated: If it relinquishes it, how could it be permanent?

original: ci ste sdug bsngal med pa'i gnas skabs skyes pa'i rgyu yin pas grol ba yin na ni de'i tshe grol ba nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: ci ste sdug bsngal med pa'i gnas skabs skyes pa'i rgyu yin pas grol ba yin na ni de'i tshe grol ba nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: But if it is liberated because it is the cause of the generation of a state that is free from suffering, then at that time it is liberated.

original: nam yang bcings par mi 'gyur na de'i tshe gzhi can gyi bcings pa dang grol ba dag tu ji ltar rab tu brtag / de bzhin du gal te sems pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid byed pa'am bskyed nus pas byed pa po yin na ni de'i tshe thams
analyzed: nam yang bcings par mi 'gyur na de'i tshe gzhi can gyi bcings pa dang grol ba dag tu ji ltar rab tu brtag / de bzhin du gal te sems pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid byed pa'am bskyed nus pas byed pa po yin na ni de'i tshe thams
translated: If it is never bound, then how could one imagine that it is bound or liberated in a basis?üîΩIn the same way, if the characteristic of mind and so on is to be an agent because it is able to generate or produce, then at that time it would be an agent in all things, but how could it be an experiencer?

original: cad du byed pa por 'gyur gyi za ba por ji ltar 'gyur 'on te bde ba la sogs pa bskyed pa'i rgyus za ba po yin na ni de'i tshe za ba po nyid du 'gyur gyi byed pa por ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: cad du byed pa por 'gyur gyi za ba por ji ltar 'gyur 'on te bde ba la sogs pa bskyed pa'i rgyus za ba po yin na ni de'i tshe za ba po nyid du 'gyur gyi byed pa por ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: But if it is an experiencer because it is the cause of generating pleasure and so on, then at that time it would be an experiencer, but how could it be an agent?

original: ser skyabs yongs su brtags pa'i bde ba la sogs pas 'gyur ba med pa nam mkha' lta bu yang za ba por rigs pa dang ldan pa ma yin te ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ser skyabs yongs su brtags pa'i bde ba la sogs pas 'gyur ba med pa nam mkha' lta bu yang za ba por rigs pa dang ldan pa ma yin te ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not logical for the unchanging, spacelike pleasure and so on imputed by Kapila to be an experiencer because that would be absurd.

original: 'gyur na ni rtag pa nyid nyams so //
analyzed: 'gyur na ni rtag pa nyid nyams so //
translated: If it changed, its permanence would be undermined.

original: rgyu tsam gyis ni byed pa po dang za ba por mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: rgyu tsam gyis ni byed pa po dang za ba por mi 'gyur te /
translated: It does not become an agent or experiencer merely through being a cause.

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would lead to absurd consequences.

original: de bzhin du dran pa po la sogs pa yang de'i gzhi can du mi rung zhes sbyar bar bya'o//
analyzed: de bzhin du dran pa po la sogs pa yang de'i gzhi can du mi rung zhes sbyar bar bya'o//
translated: In the same way, it is not tenable that the one who remembers, etc. are based on that.

original: de lta bas na bdag med par smra ba'i phyogs kho na la thar pa dang bcings pa la sogs pa rnam par gzhag pa rigs pa dang ldan te /
analyzed: de lta bas na bdag med par smra ba'i phyogs kho na la thar pa dang bcings pa la sogs pa rnam par gzhag pa rigs pa dang ldan te /
translated: Thus, only in the position of the proponents of selflessness is the presentation of bondage, freedom, etc. tenable,

original: rnam par gzhag pa de rgyu dang 'bras bu'i bye brag tsam gyis rab tu phye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par gzhag pa de rgyu dang 'bras bu'i bye brag tsam gyis rab tu phye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because that presentation is distinguished by the mere distinction of cause and effect.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po de yang mi rtag pa kho na la srid kyi rtag pa rnams la @215b ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po de yang mi rtag pa kho na la srid kyi rtag pa rnams la @215b ni ma yin te /
translated: Moreover, the state of cause and effect is possible only in the impermanent, not in the permanent,

original: de dag la 'bras bu gang la yang rim gyis bskyed pa'i mthu med de /
analyzed: de dag la 'bras bu gang la yang rim gyis bskyed pa'i mthu med de /
translated: because they lack the power to gradually generate any effect,

original: sngar ji skad bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: sngar ji skad bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: as was previously explained.

original: cig car yang ma yin te /
analyzed: cig car yang ma yin te /
translated: It is also not simultaneous,

original: yang rnam pa de lta bu'i 'bras bu bskyed pa'i mthu'i ngo bo nyid rjes su 'brang ste /
analyzed: yang rnam pa de lta bu'i 'bras bu bskyed pa'i mthu'i ngo bo nyid rjes su 'brang ste /
translated: because the essence of the power to generate an effect of that kind is not followed.

original: snga ma bzhin du 'bras bu bskyed pa dang bral bar mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du 'bras bu bskyed pa dang bral bar mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not tenable that it is devoid of producing an effect, as before.

original: rjes su mi 'brang na ni ngo bo nyid snga ma nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rjes su mi 'brang na ni ngo bo nyid snga ma nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it does not follow, then the former nature is impaired.

original: rim dang cig car dag las ma gtogs pa gang gis don byed par 'gyur ba'i rnam pa gzhan ni med de /
analyzed: rim dang cig car dag las ma gtogs pa gang gis don byed par 'gyur ba'i rnam pa gzhan ni med de /
translated: Apart from gradual and instantaneous, there is no other way that an object can be functional.

original: de gnyis ni phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de gnyis ni phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because those two are characteristics that are mutually exclusive.

original: de nyid kyi phyir skad cig pa ma yin pa gang ji snyed pa nam mkha' la sogs pa'i dngos po gzhan gyis yongs su brtags pa gang yin pa de dag thams cad ni don byed pa'i nus pa med pa'i phyir med par tha snyad gdags pa'i yul yin
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir skad cig pa ma yin pa gang ji snyed pa nam mkha' la sogs pa'i dngos po gzhan gyis yongs su brtags pa gang yin pa de dag thams cad ni don byed pa'i nus pa med pa'i phyir med par tha snyad gdags pa'i yul yin
translated: For that very reason, whatever is not momentary, and whatever is imagined to be an entity such as space, etc., by other philosophers, all of them are objects that are designated as nonexistent because they are devoid of the capacity for functional performance.

original: no zhes bya ba mkhas pa chen po sangs rgyas pa dag smra'o //
analyzed: no zhes bya ba mkhas pa chen po sangs rgyas pa dag smra'o //
translated: Thus the great scholars, the Buddhists, declare.

original: ri bong gi rva la sogs pa la med par tha snyad 'dogs pa yang don byed pa'i nus pa med pa tsam gyi rgyu'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ri bong gi rva la sogs pa la med par tha snyad 'dogs pa yang don byed pa'i nus pa med pa tsam gyi rgyu'i phyir ro //
translated: The designation of non-existence in regard to the rabbit‚Äôs horns, etc. is also due to the mere absence of the capacity for causal efficiency.

original: shugs kyis na yod par tha snyad gdags pa don byed nus pa'i yul nyid de /
analyzed: shugs kyis na yod par tha snyad gdags pa don byed nus pa'i yul nyid de /
translated: By implication, the designation of existence is in regard to the object that is capable of causal efficiency.

original: yod pa dang med pa ni phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa ni phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because existence and non-existence are characteristics that are mutually exclusive.

original: rnam pa de lta bu nus pa thams cad kyis stong pa ri bong gi rva la sogs pa dang bye brag med pa la yang dngos po zhes ming du 'dogs na ni ming la ni brtsad pa med do //
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bu nus pa thams cad kyis stong pa ri bong gi rva la sogs pa dang bye brag med pa la yang dngos po zhes ming du 'dogs na ni ming la ni brtsad pa med do //
translated: If one were to designate the name ‚Äúentity‚Äù to that which is devoid of all capacity in that way, like the rabbit‚Äôs horns, etc., then there is no argument in regard to the name.

original: 'on kyang don med pa'i 'dod pa rtogs pa dang ldan pa dag ni rnam pa de lta bu mi dmigs pa'i ngo bo nyid mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa dang bye brag med pa la dngos por tha snyad 'dogs pa rigs pa ma yin no zhes smra'o
analyzed: 'on kyang don med pa'i 'dod pa rtogs pa dang ldan pa dag ni rnam pa de lta bu mi dmigs pa'i ngo bo nyid mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa dang bye brag med pa la dngos por tha snyad 'dogs pa rigs pa ma yin no zhes smra'o
translated: However, those who are endowed with the understanding of useless desires say that it is not reasonable to designate the name ‚Äúentity‚Äù to that which is devoid of the nature of non-apprehension in that way, like the son of a barren woman, etc.

original: // de lta bas na gtan tshigs ma grub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: // de lta bas na gtan tshigs ma grub pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the reason is not unestablished.

original: nam mkha' la sogs pa la yang byed pa por thal bar 'gyur bas ma nges pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: nam mkha' la sogs pa la yang byed pa por thal bar 'gyur bas ma nges pa yang ma yin no //
translated: Nor is it uncertain, because it follows that space, etc. would be agents.

original: phyogs dang mthun pa la yod pas 'gal ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: phyogs dang mthun pa la yod pas 'gal ba yang ma yin no //
translated: Nor is it contradictory, because it exists in similar instances.

original: bdag gi mtshan nyid gzhan yang med pas de lta bas na mo gsham gyi bu dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: bdag gi mtshan nyid gzhan yang med pas de lta bas na mo gsham gyi bu dang 'dra'o //
translated: Since there is no other characteristic of the self, it is like the son of a barren woman.

original: gang zag dag kyang gal te 'jig na ni phung po rnams kho na'i nang du 'dus par thal bar 'gyur ste /
analyzed: gang zag dag kyang gal te 'jig na ni phung po rnams kho na'i nang du 'dus par thal bar 'gyur ste /
translated: If the person is destroyed, then it follows that it is included among the aggregates,

original: phung po rnams kyis 'dus byas mtha' dag bsdus pa'i phyir ro //üîΩ'on te mi 'jig na de'i tshe phung por gtogs pa'i chos @216a * //
analyzed: phung po rnams kyis 'dus byas mtha' dag bsdus pa'i phyir ro // 'on te mi 'jig na de'i tshe phung por gtogs pa'i chos @216a * //
translated: because the aggregates include all conditioned phenomena.

original: rnams dang mi 'dra bas de las don gzhan pa kho nar 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnams dang mi 'dra bas de las don gzhan pa kho nar 'gyur te /
translated: But if it is not destroyed, then at that time it would be something entirely different from the phenomena that belong to the aggregates,üîΩbecause it is not similar to them.

original: de'i nyes pa ni brjod zin to //
analyzed: de'i nyes pa ni brjod zin to //
translated: The faults of this position have already been explained.

original: de lta bas na brjod du mi rung ba zhes bya ba dngos po cung zad kyang med de /
analyzed: de lta bas na brjod du mi rung ba zhes bya ba dngos po cung zad kyang med de /
translated: Therefore, there is not the slightest entity that is inexpressible.

original: des na chos thams cad bdag med do zhes bya ba bcom ldan 'das kyi seng ge'i sgra ni mu stegs byed glang po che'i khyu mtha' dag skrag par mdzad cing brdzi ba med pa yin pas mang du mi dgos so //
analyzed: des na chos thams cad bdag med do zhes bya ba bcom ldan 'das kyi seng ge'i sgra ni mu stegs byed glang po che'i khyu mtha' dag skrag par mdzad cing brdzi ba med pa yin pas mang du mi dgos so //
translated: Therefore, the Blessed One's lion's roar, All things are devoid of self, terrifies the entire herd of the elephant-like tƒ´rthikas and is invincible.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa la sbyor ba'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa la sbyor ba'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: With regard to application in the perfections,

original: yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: he says, Again, etc.

original: de yang spyir btang ba dang dmigs kyis bsal ba'i rang bzhin tshig gnyis kyi rang bzhin du blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: de yang spyir btang ba dang dmigs kyis bsal ba'i rang bzhin tshig gnyis kyi rang bzhin du blta bar bya ste /
translated: Moreover, this should be seen as having the nature of two statements: a general statement and a specific exception.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sbyin pa sbyin par ni bya mod kyi dngos po la gnas par ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sbyin pa sbyin par ni bya mod kyi dngos po la gnas par ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The bodhisattva should practice generosity, but not while abiding in things.

original: sbyin pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni sbyin pa rnam pa gsum gyi dbang du mdzad nas pha rol tu phyin pa drug car bstan gyi sbyin pa 'ba' zhig ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sbyin pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni sbyin pa rnam pa gsum gyi dbang du mdzad nas pha rol tu phyin pa drug car bstan gyi sbyin pa 'ba' zhig ni ma yin no //
translated: Generosity indicates that the six perfections are taught with reference to the three kinds of generosity, not just to generosity alone.

original: de la zang zing sbyin pa ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa bstan no //
analyzed: de la zang zing sbyin pa ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa bstan no //
translated: The perfection of generosity is taught by the generosity of material things.

original: mi 'jigs pa sbyin pas ni tshul khrims dang bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa sbyin pas ni tshul khrims dang bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The perfections of morality and patience are taught by the generosity of fearlessness.

original: chos sbyin pas ni brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnams te /
analyzed: chos sbyin pas ni brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnams te /
translated: The perfections of effort, meditative absorption, and wisdom are taught by the generosity of the Dharma.

original: brtson 'grus med na chos bzung ba dang bstan pa la yongs su skyo ste chos mi ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: brtson 'grus med na chos bzung ba dang bstan pa la yongs su skyo ste chos mi ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one lacks effort, one becomes weary of receiving and teaching the Dharma and does not teach the Dharma.

original: bsam gtan med na dad pa las lhag par bya ba 'dod pas nyon mongs pa can gyi ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsam gtan med na dad pa las lhag par bya ba 'dod pas nyon mongs pa can gyi ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one lacks meditative absorption, one teaches the Dharma with a defiled mind, desiring to be superior to those who have faith.

original: shes rab med na de ni de la phyin ci log tu ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes rab med na de ni de la phyin ci log tu ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one lacks wisdom, one teaches the Dharma incorrectly.

original: de bas na gsum char med na chos sbyin pa 'grub par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na gsum char med na chos sbyin pa 'grub par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, if one lacks all three, the generosity of the Dharma is not accomplished.

original: gzhan dag ni brtson 'grus kun du 'gro'o zhes 'chad do //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni brtson 'grus kun du 'gro'o zhes 'chad do //
translated: Others explain that effort is omnipresent.

original: sbyin pa sbyin par bya'o zhes bya ba 'dis ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug po dag la 'dun pa dang smon lam gyis ji ltar gnas par bya ba de bstan to //
analyzed: sbyin pa sbyin par bya'o zhes bya ba 'dis ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug po dag la 'dun pa dang smon lam gyis ji ltar gnas par bya ba de bstan to //
translated: By the words one should give gifts he shows how one should stand firm in the six perfections by means of will and vow.

original: dngos po la mi gnas par zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni 'di la rnal 'byor snyoms par 'jug pas ji ltar bsgrub par bya ba de bstan to //
analyzed: dngos po la mi gnas par zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni 'di la rnal 'byor snyoms par 'jug pas ji ltar bsgrub par bya ba de bstan to //
translated: By the words without taking anything as a basis and so on, he shows how one should accomplish them by means of the yoga of concentration.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de ltar sbyin pa sbyin par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni rnam par g-yeng ba tshar bcang nas ji ltar sems rab tu gzung bar bya ba de bstan to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de ltar sbyin pa sbyin par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni rnam par g-yeng ba tshar bcang nas ji ltar sems rab tu gzung bar bya ba de bstan to //
translated: By the words the bodhisattva should give gifts in such a way and so on, he shows how one should control the mind by overcoming distraction.

original: de la dngos po la mi gnas pas ni pha rol tu phyin pa la sbyor ba'i ji lta ba @216b bzhin du yod pa bstan to //
analyzed: de la dngos po la mi gnas pas ni pha rol tu phyin pa la sbyor ba'i ji lta ba @216b bzhin du yod pa bstan to //
translated: Therein, by the words without taking anything as a basis he shows the reality of the practice of the perfections.

original: sbyin par bya ba dang / sbyin pa po dang / len pa po la sogs pa'i dngos po la de kho nar mngon par zhen pa de ni gnas pa'o zhes byang chub sems dpa' dngos po la mngon par zhen nas pha rol tu phyin pa la sbyor na log par sbyor bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: sbyin par bya ba dang / sbyin pa po dang / len pa po la sogs pa'i dngos po la de kho nar mngon par zhen pa de ni gnas pa'o zhes byang chub sems dpa' dngos po la mngon par zhen nas pha rol tu phyin pa la sbyor na log par sbyor bar 'gyur te /
translated: The bodhisattva who is attached to entities and applies himself to the perfections in order to attain them is wrongly applying himself,

original: don dam par na gang la mngon par zhen pa med par 'gyur ba'i dngos po ci yang med par phyin ci log tu mngon par zhen pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don dam par na gang la mngon par zhen pa med par 'gyur ba'i dngos po ci yang med par phyin ci log tu mngon par zhen pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he is wrongly attached to entities, since in reality there are no entities at all to which he could become attached.

original: de sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma med pa'i phyir dang / gnod pa can yod pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma med pa'i phyir dang / gnod pa can yod pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because there is no valid cognition to establish them and because there is a refutation of them.

original: 'di ltar gzhan dag gis don gyi dngos po rnam par shes pa dang tha dad pa don dam par 'dod pa de ni re zhig mngon sum du mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar gzhan dag gis don gyi dngos po rnam par shes pa dang tha dad pa don dam par 'dod pa de ni re zhig mngon sum du mi 'grub ste /
translated: Thus, the entity of an object that is different from consciousness and is accepted as ultimate is not established by direct perception,

original: don gzhan la shes pas 'dzin pa mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don gzhan la shes pas 'dzin pa mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not reasonable for one entity to apprehend another.

original: don la shes pas 'dzin pa rnam pa dang bcas pa'am /
analyzed: don la shes pas 'dzin pa rnam pa dang bcas pa'am /
translated: If consciousness apprehends an object, it must be either with an aspect or without an aspect.

original: rnam pa med pa'am /
analyzed: rnam pa med pa'am /
translated: It would be without aspects,

original: gzhan gyi rnam pa'am phyogs gsum zhig tu 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: gzhan gyi rnam pa'am phyogs gsum zhig tu 'gyur grang na /
translated: or it would have other aspects.

original: re zhig rnam pa dang bcas pas ni ma yin te ;
analyzed: re zhig rnam pa dang bcas pas ni ma yin te ;
translated: First, it is not with aspects,

original: ri mo'i gdeng ba la sogs pa mthong ba'i tshe shes pa gcig pu dang tha mi dad pas rnam pa rnams kyang gcig pu'i ngo bor thal bar 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: ri mo'i gdeng ba la sogs pa mthong ba'i tshe shes pa gcig pu dang tha mi dad pas rnam pa rnams kyang gcig pu'i ngo bor thal bar 'gyur ba'am /
translated: because when seeing a painting, etc., since it is not different from the single consciousness, it follows that the aspects would be of the nature of a single thing.

original: shes pa yang rnam pa rnams dang tha mi dad pas rnam pa'i ngo bo bzhin du du ma'i bdag nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes pa yang rnam pa rnams dang tha mi dad pas rnam pa'i ngo bo bzhin du du ma'i bdag nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Or, since consciousness is not different from the aspects, it follows that it would be of the nature of the aspects, and so be multiple.

original: du ma nyid du yang rigs pa ma yin te rdul phra rab gcig tsam 'dzin pa'i shes pa nyams su myong ba med pa'i phyir shes pa gcig mi 'grub po //
analyzed: du ma nyid du yang rigs pa ma yin te rdul phra rab gcig tsam 'dzin pa'i shes pa nyams su myong ba med pa'i phyir shes pa gcig mi 'grub po //
translated: It is not logical that it is multiple either, because without the experience of a consciousness apprehending even a single subtle particle, a single consciousness is not established.

original: de ma grub na du ma yang mi 'grub po //
analyzed: de ma grub na du ma yang mi 'grub po //
translated: If that is not established, then multiple is not established either.

original: du ma ni gcig 'dus pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: du ma ni gcig 'dus pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because multiple is the nature of the collection of single things.

original: shes pa rnams ni lus med pa'i phyir gang gis ri mo'i rnam pa nyid gzhung gzugs pa'i don du shes pa du ma skye bar rtog pa legs par 'gyur ba shes pa yul la khebs par gnas pas yongs su 'dzin par skye ba yang mi srid do //
analyzed: shes pa rnams ni lus med pa'i phyir gang gis ri mo'i rnam pa nyid gzhung gzugs pa'i don du shes pa du ma skye bar rtog pa legs par 'gyur ba shes pa yul la khebs par gnas pas yongs su 'dzin par skye ba yang mi srid do //
translated: Since cognitions are devoid of bodies, it is impossible for them to arise as the apprehender, which is the many cognitions that arise in order to form the image of the picture.

original: gzhan yang bdag nyid thams cad dam phyogs gcig 'dra bar 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: gzhan yang bdag nyid thams cad dam phyogs gcig 'dra bar 'gyur grang na /
translated: Moreover, if the cognitions are similar in all aspects or in some aspects,

original: re zhig bdag nyid thams cad du ma yin te /
analyzed: re zhig bdag nyid thams cad du ma yin te /
translated: they are not similar in all aspects.

original: don bzhin du shes pa bems po'i ngo bor 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don bzhin du shes pa bems po'i ngo bor 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because, like the object, the cognition would become an inert entity.

original: cha shas kyis kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: cha shas kyis kyang ma yin te /
translated: They are not similar in some aspects.

original: gcig pu la cha shas med pa'i phyir ro //üîΩldog pa'i bye brag gi cha shas su yongs su brtags na yang dngos po la sogs pa chos @217a * //
analyzed: gcig pu la cha shas med pa'i phyir ro // ldog pa'i bye brag gi cha shas su yongs su brtags na yang dngos po la sogs pa chos @217a * //
translated: Because a single entity has no parts.

original: 'dra ba thams cad la yod pas thams cad kyis thams cad la rig par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dra ba thams cad la yod pas thams cad kyis thams cad la rig par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the parts are imagined to be the aspects of the exclusions, since all entities and so on exist in all similar cognitions, everything would cognize everything.

original: 'on te de las skyes pa dang 'dra ba gnyis kyis rig par 'jog na ni de ma thag pa'i rkyen don mthun pa yang 'dzin par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on te de las skyes pa dang 'dra ba gnyis kyis rig par 'jog na ni de ma thag pa'i rkyen don mthun pa yang 'dzin par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: But if you posit that it is awareness because it is similar to what arises from that, then it follows that the similar objective condition is also apprehended.

original: 'dra ba yod du chug kyang don dam par phyi rol gyi don mngon gsum du mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: 'dra ba yod du chug kyang don dam par phyi rol gyi don mngon gsum du mi 'grub ste /
translated: Even if there is similarity, ultimately external objects are not established as direct perception.

original: shes pas sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa bdag la yod pa rig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes pas sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa bdag la yod pa rig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because consciousness is aware of the aspect of blue, etc. that exists in itself.

original: gang gis don yang mngon sum du 'gyur ba sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam par rig pa gnyis pa ni med do //
analyzed: gang gis don yang mngon sum du 'gyur ba sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam par rig pa gnyis pa ni med do //
translated: There is no second awareness of blue, etc. that would make the object a direct perception.

original: gal te gang de'i rnam par shes pa de nyid don 'dzin pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te gang de'i rnam par shes pa de nyid don 'dzin pa yin no //
translated: If you say that the very consciousness of that is the apprehension of the object,

original: zhe na / brtags pa'i sgo nas ni yin gyi don dam par de rig pa ni med de /
analyzed: zhe na / brtags pa'i sgo nas ni yin gyi don dam par de rig pa ni med de /
translated: it is so in terms of imputation, but in reality there is no awareness of that.

original: bdag la yod pa'i rnam pa nyid rig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag la yod pa'i rnam pa nyid rig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is aware of the aspect that exists in itself.

original: don shin tu lkog tu gyur pa'i phyir ro shes pa de'i rnam pa kho na yin no zhes bya ba de lta bu ga la yod /
analyzed: don shin tu lkog tu gyur pa'i phyir ro shes pa de'i rnam pa kho na yin no zhes bya ba de lta bu ga la yod /
translated: How can it be that the aspect of that consciousness is the object itself, because the object is extremely hidden?

original: rgyu ni nges par bdag gi ngo bo bskrun pa kho nas skyed par byed pa nyid du grub pa med de 'khrul pa snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu ni nges par bdag gi ngo bo bskrun pa kho nas skyed par byed pa nyid du grub pa med de 'khrul pa snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The cause is not established as the producer by merely producing the nature of the self, because the appearance is mistaken.

original: rdul phra rab rnams kyi rags par snang ba'i shes pa'i yul ma yin te /
analyzed: rdul phra rab rnams kyi rags par snang ba'i shes pa'i yul ma yin te /
translated: The subtle particles are not the object of the cognition that appears as gross,

original: de dag phra ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag phra ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are subtle.

original: de dag 'dus pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de dag 'dus pa yang ma yin te /
translated: They are not an aggregation,

original: de dag las don gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag las don gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are not different from those.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i yul yang dngos po med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i yul yang dngos po med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The object of conceptualization is also not a thing.

original: 'dus pa'i don gzhan na ni phyogs tha dad par snang ba'i phyir dang / bsgribs pa dang ma bsgribs pa chos mi mthun pa dang ldan pa'i phyir gcig pur mi rigs so //
analyzed: 'dus pa'i don gzhan na ni phyogs tha dad par snang ba'i phyir dang / bsgribs pa dang ma bsgribs pa chos mi mthun pa dang ldan pa'i phyir gcig pur mi rigs so //
translated: If the meaning of aggregation is different, it is not reasonable as a single thing because it appears as different parts and because it has the discordant properties of being obstructed and unobstructed.

original: 'dus pa du ma yin na yang rdul phra rab de dag nyid yin par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: 'dus pa du ma yin na yang rdul phra rab de dag nyid yin par 'gyur gyi /
translated: If it is many aggregations, it is just those subtle particles.

original: de don gzhan pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de don gzhan pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not different from those.

original: rnam pa med pa zhes bya ba'i phyogs kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa med pa zhes bya ba'i phyogs kyang ma yin te /
translated: It is also not the position called ‚Äúwithout aspect,‚ÄùüîΩbecause it is not reasonable that the object is different from the cognition.

original: de sngon po la sogs pa la ci yang mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de sngon po la sogs pa la ci yang mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it does not do anything to blue, etc.

original: yod pa tsam gyis rig na ni shes pa thams cad kyis thams cad rig par 'gyur te /
analyzed: yod pa tsam gyis rig na ni shes pa thams cad kyis thams cad rig par 'gyur te /
translated: If it cognizes by mere existence, then all consciousnesses would cognize all objects,

original: thams cad la yang bye brag med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad la yang bye brag med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no difference in mere existence.

original: de bas na 'di ni sngon po rig pa yin gyi ser po ni ma yin no zhes rnam par gzhag par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bas na 'di ni sngon po rig pa yin gyi ser po ni ma yin no zhes rnam par gzhag par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, it would not be possible to posit, ‚ÄúThis is the cognition of blue, but not the cognition of yellow,‚Äù

original: rnam par gzhag pa'i rgyu'i bye brag gang yang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par gzhag pa'i rgyu'i bye brag gang yang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there would be no difference in the cause of the positing.

original: bye brag gcig khas len na ni de nyid rnam pa dang bcas par khas blangs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: bye brag gcig khas len na ni de nyid rnam pa dang bcas par khas blangs par 'gyur te /
translated: If you accept a difference, then you would have to accept that it has aspects,

original: @217b rtog pa'i ngo bo tsam du bye brag med pa'i shes pa'i bdag nyid la ni rnam pa ma gtogs par tha dad pa gzhan med do //
analyzed: @217b rtog pa'i ngo bo tsam du bye brag med pa'i shes pa'i bdag nyid la ni rnam pa ma gtogs par tha dad pa gzhan med do //
translated: because there is no difference in the nature of consciousness, which is merely the nature of cognition.

original: gzhan gyi rnam pa zhes bya ba'i phyogs kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi rnam pa zhes bya ba'i phyogs kyang ma yin te /
translated: It is not the position of others,

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because that would lead to absurd consequences.

original: de lta na ni rnam pa'i rnam par shes pa yang gzugs kyi yul can du brtag par bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na ni rnam pa'i rnam par shes pa yang gzugs kyi yul can du brtag par bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, the consciousness of the aspect would be considered to have form as its object.

original: de lta bas na don mngon sum du 'grub po //
analyzed: de lta bas na don mngon sum du 'grub po //
translated: Therefore, the object is established by perception.

original: rjes su dpag pas kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pas kyang ma yin te /
translated: It is not by inference,

original: mngon sum du ma gyur pa'i don de dang shes pa la sogs pa rtags gang dang yang lhan cig 'brel par ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon sum du ma gyur pa'i don de dang shes pa la sogs pa rtags gang dang yang lhan cig 'brel par ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that object which is not perceived is not established as being related to any reason, such as consciousness, etc.

original: shes pa 'bras bu dang tha dad pa zhig spyir rgyu tsam du rjes su dpog na ni 'dod pa mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: shes pa 'bras bu dang tha dad pa zhig spyir rgyu tsam du rjes su dpog na ni 'dod pa mi 'grub ste /
translated: If one infers a consciousness which is different from the effect, in general, as merely a cause, then one does not establish what one wants to establish,

original: rgyu gzhan de ma thag pa'i rkyen gzhan yang yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu gzhan de ma thag pa'i rkyen gzhan yang yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is another cause, namely, the immediately preceding condition.

original: tshad ma gzhan yang med do //
analyzed: tshad ma gzhan yang med do //
translated: There is no other means of valid knowledge.

original: de bas na re zhig phyi rol gyi don ni mi 'grub po //
analyzed: de bas na re zhig phyi rol gyi don ni mi 'grub po //
translated: Therefore, the external object is not established.

original: shes pa'i bdag nyid don dam pa yang mngon sum du mi 'grub ste gnyis su med pa'i bdag nyid so sor rig pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes pa'i bdag nyid don dam pa yang mngon sum du mi 'grub ste gnyis su med pa'i bdag nyid so sor rig pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The ultimate nature of consciousness is not established by perception, because there is no awareness of a nature which is nondual.

original: de la ma yin na ni thams cad de kho na mthong bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la ma yin na ni thams cad de kho na mthong bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were not so, then no one would see reality.

original: rjes su dpag pas kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pas kyang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it by inference,

original: rnam pa de lta bu dang rtags gang yang lhan cig 'brel par ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bu dang rtags gang yang lhan cig 'brel par ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because no reason is established as being concomitant with such an aspect.

original: gal te kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang bar ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gal te kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang bar ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If you ask, ‚ÄúHow then are there defilement and purification?‚Äù

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: It is not so,

original: khyod kyi ltar na de gnyis dang de gang yang 'brel bar ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyod kyi ltar na de gnyis dang de gang yang 'brel bar ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because according to you, neither of these two is established as being concomitant with that.

original: de gnyis ni don dam pa pa'i dngos po dang gang du gang 'brel par ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de gnyis ni don dam pa pa'i dngos po dang gang du gang 'brel par ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: These two are not established as being concomitant with any ultimate entity.

original: de las skyed pa'i mtshan nyid kyis 'brel par ma grub ste /
analyzed: de las skyed pa'i mtshan nyid kyis 'brel par ma grub ste /
translated: They are not established as being concomitant by the characteristic of being produced from that,

original: de ni thams cad du lkog tu gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni thams cad du lkog tu gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that is completely hidden from everyone.

original: lkog tu gyur pa dang 'brel pa ni tshu rol mthong ba gang gis kyang gzung bar mi nus so //
analyzed: lkog tu gyur pa dang 'brel pa ni tshu rol mthong ba gang gis kyang gzung bar mi nus so //
translated: No one with limited vision can apprehend what is concomitant with the hidden.

original: gang gi tshe ma rig pa la sogs pa ma brtags na dga' ba yang kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rtsa bar 'gal ba med la /üîΩma rig pa la sogs pa brtags na dga' ba log na rnam par byang ba de dang mi mthun pa'i gnas 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid ma brtags gcig pu na dga' ba yang 'thad pa de'i tshe don dam par dngos po med pas de gnyis kyang med par ji
analyzed: gang gi tshe ma rig pa la sogs pa ma brtags na dga' ba yang kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rtsa bar 'gal ba med la / ma rig pa la sogs pa brtags na dga' ba log na rnam par byang ba de dang mi mthun pa'i gnas 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid ma brtags gcig pu na dga' ba yang 'thad pa de'i tshe don dam par dngos po med pas de gnyis kyang med par ji
translated: When ignorance, etc., are not examined, they are not incompatible with the root of the afflictions.

original: ltar thal bar 'gyur /
analyzed: ltar thal bar 'gyur /
translated: When ignorance, etc., are examined, if they are refuted, then purification, which is the opposite of that, would arise. When they are not examined, it is also tenable that they are delightful. At that time, since there are no ultimate things, how could it follow that those two do not exist?

original: gang zhig de gnyis gcig tu nges par rgyu med par khas len pa @218a * //
analyzed: gang zhig de gnyis gcig tu nges par rgyu med par khas len pa @218a * //
translated: This reductio is advanced against those who assert that those two are definitely one and causeless.

original: de la thal ba 'di 'byung gi / kun rdzob tu rten cing 'brel bar 'byung bar smra ba la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de la thal ba 'di 'byung gi / kun rdzob tu rten cing 'brel bar 'byung bar smra ba la ni ma yin no //
translated: It does not apply to those who advocate that they are dependently arisen conventionally.

original: de lta bas na don dam pa'i dngos po rang bzhin bsgrub par med pa'i chad ma ni cung zad kyang med do //
analyzed: de lta bas na don dam pa'i dngos po rang bzhin bsgrub par med pa'i chad ma ni cung zad kyang med do //
translated: Therefore, there is not the slightest nonexistence of ultimate things that is established by its own nature.

original: gnod pa can ni yod pa nyid de 'di ltar gang gcig dang du ma'i ngo bo nyid dang bral ba de ni don dam par ngo bo nyid med de /
analyzed: gnod pa can ni yod pa nyid de 'di ltar gang gcig dang du ma'i ngo bo nyid dang bral ba de ni don dam par ngo bo nyid med de /
translated: The harmful is existent, because thus, that which is devoid of the nature of one and many is ultimately natureless.

original: dper na nam mkha'i padma ji lta ba bzhin la /
analyzed: dper na nam mkha'i padma ji lta ba bzhin la /
translated: For example, like a sky-lotus.

original: gzhan dag gis 'dod pas shes pa dang shes bya'i bdag nyid dngos po'i rnam pa thams cad kyang gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin gyis stong pa zhes bya ba ni don gyis na khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhan dag gis 'dod pas shes pa dang shes bya'i bdag nyid dngos po'i rnam pa thams cad kyang gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin gyis stong pa zhes bya ba ni don gyis na khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa yin te /
translated: The meaning of the statement by others that all aspects of entities, which are the nature of the object of knowledge and the means of knowledge, are empty of the nature of one and many is the non-apprehension of the pervader,

original: gcig dang du ma dag gis ni ngo bo nyid la khyab pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig dang du ma dag gis ni ngo bo nyid la khyab pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one and many pervade nature.

original: de gnyis kyang de la med de /
analyzed: de gnyis kyang de la med de /
translated: Those two do not exist in that.

original: 'di ltar re zhig gang gzugs la sogs pa'i skye mched phyi rol gyi dngos po de ni gcig pu ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar re zhig gang gzugs la sogs pa'i skye mched phyi rol gyi dngos po de ni gcig pu ma yin te /
translated: Thus, first, that external thing, the sense-spheres such as form, is not one,

original: bsgribs pa dang ma bsgribs pa la sogs pa chos 'gal ba dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsgribs pa dang ma bsgribs pa la sogs pa chos 'gal ba dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the observation of contradictory attributes such as obscured and unobscured is observed.

original: chos 'gal ba dang ldan bzhin du yang gcig pa nyid ni thams cad kyang rdzas gcig tu 'gyur te /
analyzed: chos 'gal ba dang ldan bzhin du yang gcig pa nyid ni thams cad kyang rdzas gcig tu 'gyur te /
translated: And if it were to possess contradictory properties, then everything would be a single substance.

original: de'i phyir lhan cig 'byung ba dang 'jig par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir lhan cig 'byung ba dang 'jig par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it would arise and perish simultaneously.

original: du ma yang ma yin te /
analyzed: du ma yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it multiple,

original: 'di ltar du mar bshig na rdul phra rab tu tha dad par 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'di ltar du mar bshig na rdul phra rab tu tha dad par 'gyur la /
translated: because if it were destroyed as multiple, it would be different from the subtle atom.

original: rdul phra rab rnams kyang cha shas med pa'i phyir pha rol dang tshul rol na gnas pa ni med de sems dang sems las byung ba bzhin no //
analyzed: rdul phra rab rnams kyang cha shas med pa'i phyir pha rol dang tshul rol na gnas pa ni med de sems dang sems las byung ba bzhin no //
translated: And the subtle atoms do not exist as being on the other side or this side, because they are partless, like mind and mental functions.

original: de'i phyir phyogs la khyab par gnas par snang bar yang mi 'gyur ba zhig na 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i phyir phyogs la khyab par gnas par snang bar yang mi 'gyur ba zhig na 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, it would not appear to abide pervading the directions, but it does.

original: de bas na phyogs cha tha dad par khas blang bar bya'o ;
analyzed: de bas na phyogs cha tha dad par khas blang bar bya'o ;
translated: Therefore, it must be accepted that it has different directional parts.

original: / de khas len na ni gcig par ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: / de khas len na ni gcig par ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: If that is accepted, how can it be one?

original: de lta bas na de ltar re zhig phyi rol gyi don gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin dang bral ba nyid du grub bo //
analyzed: de lta bas na de ltar re zhig phyi rol gyi don gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin dang bral ba nyid du grub bo //
translated: Thus, in this way, external objects are established as being devoid of the nature of being one or many.

original: sngon po la sogs par snang ba'i shes pa yang ri mo'i rnam pa 'dzin par snang ba'i phyir gcig pu'i ngo bo nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: sngon po la sogs par snang ba'i shes pa yang ri mo'i rnam pa 'dzin par snang ba'i phyir gcig pu'i ngo bo nyid ma yin te /
translated: Also, the consciousness that appears as blue and so on is not of the nature of a single entity because it appears to apprehend the aspects of the picture.

original: tha dad pa'i rgyud la yod pa'i rnam par shes pa'i skad cig ma du ma bzhin no //
analyzed: tha dad pa'i rgyud la yod pa'i rnam par shes pa'i skad cig ma du ma bzhin no //
translated: It is like the many moments of consciousness that exist in different continua.

original: du ma rnam grangs bzhin du rnam par shes pa cig car 'byung ngo zhes brjod du yang mi rung ste /
analyzed: du ma rnam grangs bzhin du rnam par shes pa cig car 'byung ngo zhes brjod du yang mi rung ste /
translated: It is also not tenable to say that consciousness arises simultaneously with the many aspects, as in the case of the enumeration of the many.

original: cha shas med pa dang lus med pa rnams la ni /
analyzed: cha shas med pa dang lus med pa rnams la ni /
translated: Because for those that are partless and bodiless,

original: tshu rol dang pha rol na gnas pa mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshu rol dang pha rol na gnas pa mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: it is not logical that they exist in the east and the west.

original: de ltar gnas pa med na ni /
analyzed: de ltar gnas pa med na ni /
translated: If they do not exist in that way,

original: de ltar snang bar @218b mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar snang bar @218b mi 'gyur ro //
translated: they would not appear in that way.

original: 'on te rnam par shes pa ni gcig pu kho na yin la /
analyzed: 'on te rnam par shes pa ni gcig pu kho na yin la /
translated: But if consciousness is singular,

original: rnam pa brdzun pa rnams de la snang bas sna tshogs kyi skyon du mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: rnam pa brdzun pa rnams de la snang bas sna tshogs kyi skyon du mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: and the false aspects appear to it, the error of multiplicity does not arise.

original: gal te de lta na go brdzun pa de dag ji ltar de la snang bar 'gyur /
analyzed: gal te de lta na go brdzun pa de dag ji ltar de la snang bar 'gyur /
translated: If that were so, how could those false aspects appear to it?

original: snang zhes bya ba ni gsal ba'i bdag nyid la bya ste /
analyzed: snang zhes bya ba ni gsal ba'i bdag nyid la bya ste /
translated: ‚ÄúAppearance‚Äù refers to the nature of clarity.

original: de ni shes pa'i bdag nyid du gtogs pa'i chos yin na brdzun ba ri bong gi rva la sogs pa dang 'dra bar shin du med na go snang bar ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: de ni shes pa'i bdag nyid du gtogs pa'i chos yin na brdzun ba ri bong gi rva la sogs pa dang 'dra bar shin du med na go snang bar ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: If that is utterly nonexistent, like a rabbit‚Äôs horns, and so on, which are false, how could they appear?

original: de lta bas na gsal ba'i bdag nyid kyi rnam pa rnams brdzun pa nyid du khas len na khyod kyi bden par 'gyur ba gang yin pa shes pa'i ngo bo gzhan ci zhig lus te /
analyzed: de lta bas na gsal ba'i bdag nyid kyi rnam pa rnams brdzun pa nyid du khas len na khyod kyi bden par 'gyur ba gang yin pa shes pa'i ngo bo gzhan ci zhig lus te /
translated: Therefore, if you accept that the aspects that are the nature of clarity are false, what other nature of consciousness remains that is true for you?

original: rnam par shes pa yang gsal ba'i bdag nyid zhes bya ba ci yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa yang gsal ba'i bdag nyid zhes bya ba ci yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Consciousness also is not anything that is called the nature of clarity.

original: gzhan rnam par bcad pa la ltos nas bye brag rnams kho na la spyir tha snyad 'dogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan rnam par bcad pa la ltos nas bye brag rnams kho na la spyir tha snyad 'dogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the term ‚Äúgeneral‚Äù is applied to the particulars themselves in dependence on the exclusion of other.

original: bye brag rnams brdzun na ni thams cad kyang brdzun par shin du gsal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: bye brag rnams brdzun na ni thams cad kyang brdzun par shin du gsal bar 'gyur te /
translated: If the particulars are false, it is extremely clear that everything is false.

original: rnam par yod pa ma yin pa rnams ni bden pa'i ngo bo'i shes pa'i bdag nyid de la gang gis na de la nges par snang bar 'gyur ba de'i bdag nyid kyi mtshan nyid dam /
analyzed: rnam par yod pa ma yin pa rnams ni bden pa'i ngo bo'i shes pa'i bdag nyid de la gang gis na de la nges par snang bar 'gyur ba de'i bdag nyid kyi mtshan nyid dam /
translated: Those that are not real are not of the nature of consciousness, which is true.üîΩ

original: de las 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyis 'brel pa yang med do //
analyzed: de las 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyis 'brel pa yang med do //
translated: Those that do not exist as real entities do not have a nature that is the nature of a cognition of reality, and there is no relationship with them by way of a nature that is the nature of that, or by way of a nature that arises from that.

original: 'brel pa med na ni snang bar mi rigs te /
analyzed: 'brel pa med na ni snang bar mi rigs te /

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it would follow, absurdly, that anything could appear to anything.

original: de bas na gtan tshigs ma grub pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na gtan tshigs ma grub pa yang ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the reason is not unestablished.

original: dngos po'i rnam pa gzhan med pa'i phyir ma nges pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po'i rnam pa gzhan med pa'i phyir ma nges pa yang ma yin no //
translated: Nor is it indefinite, because there is no other aspect of a thing.

original: mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa'i phyir 'gal ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa'i phyir 'gal ba yang ma yin no //
translated: Nor is it contradictory, because it exists in the similar class.

original: de lta bas na dngos po rnams ji lta ji ltar rnam par brtags pa de lta de ltar 'brel lo//
analyzed: de lta bas na dngos po rnams ji lta ji ltar rnam par brtags pa de lta de ltar 'brel lo//
translated: Therefore, things are related in just the way that they are imagined.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: For this very reason,

original: dngos rnams ji ltar rnam brtags na //
analyzed: dngos rnams ji ltar rnam brtags na //
translated: whatever things are imagined,

original: bden bar de yi ngo bo med //
analyzed: bden bar de yi ngo bo med //
translated: they do not truly exist in that way.

original: 'di ltar de dag gcig pu dang // du ma'i ngo bor yod ma yin //üîΩzhes bshad do //
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag gcig pu dang // du ma'i ngo bor yod ma yin // zhes bshad do //
translated: In the nature of one or many.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa las /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa las /
translated: The BhagavƒÅn also said in the noble La·πÖkƒÅvatƒÅra S≈´tra:

original: ji ltar gzugs rnams me long la ;
analyzed: ji ltar gzugs rnams me long la ;
translated: Just as forms in a mirror

original: / gcig dang gzhan yang rnam spangs par //
analyzed: / gcig dang gzhan yang rnam spangs par //
translated: Are neither the same nor different,

original: snang yang de na yod ma yin //
analyzed: snang yang de na yod ma yin //
translated: They appear but do not exist there.

original: de ltar dngos po'i ngo bo nyid //
analyzed: de ltar dngos po'i ngo bo nyid //
translated: So it is with the nature of things.

original: blo yis rnam par gzhigs na go //
analyzed: blo yis rnam par gzhigs na go //
translated: When the mind analyzes,

original: ngo bo nyid ni gzung du med //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid ni gzung du med //
translated: The nature is ungraspable.

original: de phyir de dag brjod med cing //
analyzed: de phyir de dag brjod med cing //
translated: Therefore they are said to be inexpressible

original: ngo bo nyid kyang med par bshad //üîΩces gsungs so //üîΩde bzhin @219a * //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyang med par bshad // ces gsungs so // de bzhin @219a * //
translated: And also natureless.

original: du 'phags pa ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyal po'i mdo las kyang /üîΩdper na chu shing rlon pa'i sdong po la //
analyzed: du 'phags pa ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyal po'i mdo las kyang / dper na chu shing rlon pa'i sdong po la //
translated: And similarly, in the noble King of SamƒÅdhis S≈´tra it says:üîΩFor example, a person seeking the pith

original: snying po 'dod mis rim par bshig byas kyang //
analyzed: snying po 'dod mis rim par bshig byas kyang //
translated: Might cut open a plantain tree

original: phyi dang nang na snying po yod min pa //
analyzed: phyi dang nang na snying po yod min pa //
