original: de ltar chos rnams thams cad shes par gyis //üîΩzhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de ltar chos rnams thams cad shes par gyis //üîΩzhes gsungs so //
translated: Know that all phenomena are like this.

original: de lta bas na dngos po thams cad sgyu ma bzhin du ma brtags na dga' ba yin pas de ltar mngon par ma zhen par sbyin pa sbyin bar bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na dngos po thams cad sgyu ma bzhin du ma brtags na dga' ba yin pas de ltar mngon par ma zhen par sbyin pa sbyin bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, since all things are like illusions, delightful when not examined, one should give gifts without settling on them in that way.

original: dngos po la gnas pas ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don 'di 'dir rigs pa dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: dngos po la gnas pas ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don 'di 'dir rigs pa dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúnot by settling on things‚Äù is appropriate here.

original: de ltar na sbyin pa la sogs pa la sbyor ba ji lta ba bzhin du yong pa yongs su bstan pa yin gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na sbyin pa la sogs pa la sbyor ba ji lta ba bzhin du yong pa yongs su bstan pa yin gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: Thus, the proper application to generosity and so on is taught, not something else.

original: gal te don dam par dngos po ci yang med pas dngos po la gnas pas sbyin pa sbyin par me bya na dngos po med pa la mngon par zhen pas sbyin par bya ba lta zhig snyam pa las /
analyzed: gal te don dam par dngos po ci yang med pas dngos po la gnas pas sbyin pa sbyin par me bya na dngos po med pa la mngon par zhen pas sbyin par bya ba lta zhig snyam pa las /
translated: If one should not give gifts by settling on things, since ultimately nothing exists at all, then perhaps one should give gifts by settling on the absence of things?

original: ci la yang mi gnas par zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: ci la yang mi gnas par zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: To this, he says, ‚ÄúNot settling on anything at all.‚Äù

original: byang chub sems dpas dngos po med par rnam par rtog pa yang spang bar bya ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas dngos po med par rnam par rtog pa yang spang bar bya ste /
translated: The bodhisattva should also abandon the conception of the absence of things.

original: de ni dngos por 'dzin pa med na med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni dngos por 'dzin pa med na med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is because it does not exist if there is no apprehension of things.

original: kun rdzob tu ni sbyin par bya ba dang / sbyin pa po la sogs pa yod de /
analyzed: kun rdzob tu ni sbyin par bya ba dang / sbyin pa po la sogs pa yod de /
translated: In the conventional, the object of giving, the giver, etc. exist.

original: de'i phyir dngos po med pa la mngon par zhen pa yang mi rigs par dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos po med pa la mngon par zhen pa yang mi rigs par dgongs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is not reasonable to cling to non-existence.

original: gzugs la mi gnas par zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni byang chub sems dpas gang la mi gnas par sbyin pa sbyin par bya ba de nyid rgyas par ston to //
analyzed: gzugs la mi gnas par zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni byang chub sems dpas gang la mi gnas par sbyin pa sbyin par bya ba de nyid rgyas par ston to //
translated: The phrase not dwelling on form, etc. extensively teaches just that giving of the bodhisattva which is given without dwelling on anything.

original: chos zhes bya ba'i sgras ni chos kyi skye mched yongs su gzung ngo //
analyzed: chos zhes bya ba'i sgras ni chos kyi skye mched yongs su gzung ngo //
translated: The word dharma refers to the sense-sphere of mental objects.

original: skye mched 'dis ni spros te mtshon pa yin pas des na mig la sogs pa nang gi skye mched rnams ma smos so //
analyzed: skye mched 'dis ni spros te mtshon pa yin pas des na mig la sogs pa nang gi skye mched rnams ma smos so //
translated: Since this sense-sphere is an illustration through elaboration, the internal sense-spheres such as the eye are not mentioned.

original: mi skye ba la sogs par rnam par rtog pa yang mi bya'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir rab 'byor ci nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: mi skye ba la sogs par rnam par rtog pa yang mi bya'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir rab 'byor ci nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to demonstrate that one should not even form the concepts of non-arising, etc., it is said: Subhuti, if a Bodhisattva, etc.

original: mtshan ma ni dngos po'i rang gi mtshon pa ste rtags so //
analyzed: mtshan ma ni dngos po'i rang gi mtshon pa ste rtags so //
translated: A sign is the own-mark of an entity, its indication, its indication.

original: de yang ma skyes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de yang ma skyes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: And that is non-arising, etc.

original: de la rtogs pa ni 'du shes so //
analyzed: de la rtogs pa ni 'du shes so //
translated: ‚ÄúRealization‚Äù is perception.

original: de la rnam par mi rtog pa ni de la mi gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de la rnam par mi rtog pa ni de la mi gnas pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúNon-conceptuality‚Äù is non-abiding in that.

original: des ni ci la yang mi gnas par zhes bya ba de bstan to //
analyzed: des ni ci la yang mi gnas par zhes bya ba de bstan to //
translated: This shows ‚Äúhe does not abide in anything at all.‚Äù

original: yang na 'di mtha' dag gis ni 'dis zab pa yang bstan la /
analyzed: yang na 'di mtha' dag gis ni 'dis zab pa yang bstan la /
translated: Or, this entire passage shows the profundity of the perfection of wisdom,

original: sgro btags pa dang skur ba 'debs pa'i mtha' dgag pa yang bstan to //
analyzed: sgro btags pa dang skur ba 'debs pa'i mtha' dgag pa yang bstan to //
translated: and also shows the refutation of the extremes of superimposition and denial.

original: dmigs pa can rnams @219b lta ba 'di la ni bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs par bya bar rung ba bkag ste /
analyzed: dmigs pa can rnams @219b lta ba 'di la ni bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs par bya bar rung ba bkag ste /
translated: For the objectifiers, this view is refuted as being suitable for completing the accumulations of merit and wisdom.

original: 'di ltar mchod pa dang phan gdags par 'dod pas gang byin pa de shin tu dang ba bskyed kyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar mchod pa dang phan gdags par 'dod pas gang byin pa de shin tu dang ba bskyed kyi /
translated: Thus, those who wish to make offerings and to benefit should give with great faith,

original: sbyin par bya ba dang / sbyin pa po dang / len pa po mi dmigs pa la gnas pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sbyin par bya ba dang / sbyin pa po dang / len pa po mi dmigs pa la gnas pas ni ma yin no //
translated: but not by abiding in the non-apprehension of the gift, the giver, and the receiver.

original: 'di ltar med pa'i phyir sbyin par bya ba la sogs pa mi dmigs sam 'on te yul med pa'i phyir phyogs dang po ni sus ci yang byin pa med pas bsod nams med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar med pa'i phyir sbyin par bya ba la sogs pa mi dmigs sam 'on te yul med pa'i phyir phyogs dang po ni sus ci yang byin pa med pas bsod nams med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Or, because the object does not exist, the first position is that nothing is given at all, so it follows that there is no merit.

original: sems can dag med pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams sems can gyi don gyi phyir yongs su ngal bar byas pa de yang don med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: sems can dag med pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams sems can gyi don gyi phyir yongs su ngal bar byas pa de yang don med par 'gyur te /
translated: And because sentient beings do not exist, the efforts of bodhisattvas for the sake of sentient beings would be pointless.

original: de lta bas na med pa kho na ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na med pa kho na ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not that they do not exist at all.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis sbyin par bya ba la sogs pa'i dngos po gzigs pas yul ma yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis sbyin par bya ba la sogs pa'i dngos po gzigs pas yul ma yin no //
translated: The Lord sees the things to be given and so on, so they are not nonexistent objects.

original: de lta ma yin na 'dod pa rnams la bcom ldan 'das kyis sras la sogs pa ji ltar yongs su btang bar 'gyur zhes rgol bar byed pa de mtha' dag sems la bzhag nas /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na 'dod pa rnams la bcom ldan 'das kyis sras la sogs pa ji ltar yongs su btang bar 'gyur zhes rgol bar byed pa de mtha' dag sems la bzhag nas /
translated: Otherwise, how could the Lord give his sons and so on, as he did in the desire realm?

original: de ci'i slad du zhes zhus pa dang lan du /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhes zhus pa dang lan du /
translated: Having placed all of this in his mind, he asked, ‚ÄúWhy is that?‚ÄùüîΩAnd in reply, the Buddha said,

original: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' gang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: rab 'byor byang chub sems dpa' gang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Subh≈´ti, a bodhisattva who...

original: dgongs pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: dgongs pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The idea is this:

original: yang dag pa'i lta ba las byung ba'i sbyin pa la sogs pa ni yongs su dag pa'i phyir 'bras bu yid du 'ong ba khyad par du 'phags pa mngon par 'grub par byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lta ba las byung ba'i sbyin pa la sogs pa ni yongs su dag pa'i phyir 'bras bu yid du 'ong ba khyad par du 'phags pa mngon par 'grub par byed pa yin gyi /
translated: Giving and so on that arise from right view are pure, and so they produce a special, pleasant result.

original: phyin ci log nas 'byung bas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: phyin ci log nas 'byung bas ni ma yin no //
translated: But they do not arise from error.

original: log par lta ba las byung ba'i tshul khrims kyi yan lag la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: log par lta ba las byung ba'i tshul khrims kyi yan lag la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like the branches of morality and so on that arise from wrong views.

original: sbyin par bya ba la sogs pa'i dngos po ni ji skad smos pa'i tshul gyis na gang yang med pas der dmigs pa ni phyin ci log kho na ste /
analyzed: sbyin par bya ba la sogs pa'i dngos po ni ji skad smos pa'i tshul gyis na gang yang med pas der dmigs pa ni phyin ci log kho na ste /
translated: Since there is no thing to be given and so on in the way that it is described, any observation of it is just error.

original: smig rgyu la chur dmigs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: smig rgyu la chur dmigs pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like observing water in a mirage.

original: de bas na de las byung ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshul thams cad ni bdag dang bdag gir phyin ci log las byung ba'i sbyin pa la sogs pa bzhin du rgyu rnam par dag pa ma yin pa las byung bas stobs chung ba'o //
analyzed: de bas na de las byung ba'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i tshul thams cad ni bdag dang bdag gir phyin ci log las byung ba'i sbyin pa la sogs pa bzhin du rgyu rnam par dag pa ma yin pa las byung bas stobs chung ba'o //
translated: Therefore, all the perfections that arise from that are weak, because they arise from an impure cause, like the generosity, etc. that arise from the error of self and possession.

original: sbyin par bya ba la sogs pa dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa mi dmigs pa ni yang dag pa'i don gyis yul yin pas phyin ci ma log pa ste /
analyzed: sbyin par bya ba la sogs pa dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa mi dmigs pa ni yang dag pa'i don gyis yul yin pas phyin ci ma log pa ste /
translated: The non-apprehension of the object of generosity, etc. that is apprehended as a sign is the object of the correct meaning, and so is non-erroneous.

original: smig rgyu la chur dmigs pa bzhin no //üîΩde bas na rgyas pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i phyir de las sbyin pa @220a * //
analyzed: smig rgyu la chur dmigs pa bzhin no // de bas na rgyas pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i phyir de las sbyin pa @220a * //
translated: It is like the apprehension of water in a mirage.

original: la sogs pa 'bras bu che ba yin te /
analyzed: la sogs pa 'bras bu che ba yin te /
translated: Therefore, generosity, etc. have great results because they arise from the cause of expansion.

original: sa bon grung po las mngon par grub pa'i myu gu la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: sa bon grung po las mngon par grub pa'i myu gu la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: Like a sprout, etc. that are produced from a healthy seed.

original: de bas na mi dmigs pa la gnas pa'i sbyin pa la sogs pa de ni yang dag pa'i lta ba las byung bas mkhas pa rnams la shin du dang ba bskyed pa yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na mi dmigs pa la gnas pa'i sbyin pa la sogs pa de ni yang dag pa'i lta ba las byung bas mkhas pa rnams la shin du dang ba bskyed pa yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: Thus, the generosity, etc. of one who abides in non-apprehension is generated from the correct view and is, therefore, very clear to the wise, but not to others.

original: gang gis na sbyin pa la sogs pa la mi 'jug pa'i phyir bsod nams med par 'gyur ba sbyin par bya ba la sogs pa gcig tu med par 'dod pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gis na sbyin pa la sogs pa la mi 'jug pa'i phyir bsod nams med par 'gyur ba sbyin par bya ba la sogs pa gcig tu med par 'dod pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it the case that one should assert the total non-existence of the gift, etc. because of the non-engagement in generosity, etc.

original: kun rdzob tu yod par khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu yod par khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: for, it is accepted as existing in the conventional sense.

original: mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i gnas skabs na sgyu ma lta bur dmigs pa'i phyir thams cad du dmigs pa med pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i gnas skabs na sgyu ma lta bur dmigs pa'i phyir thams cad du dmigs pa med pa yang ma yin no //
translated: Nor is it the case that there is no apprehension at all, because of the apprehension of the illusion-like in the non-concentrated state.

original: de'i tshe na yang mos pa las byung ba'i dmigs par ni rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: de'i tshe na yang mos pa las byung ba'i dmigs par ni rnam par gzhag go //
translated: At that time, it is established as the apprehension of the imagination.

original: mnyam par bzhag pa'i gnas skabs na ni shin tu dmigs pa med pa kho na ste /
analyzed: mnyam par bzhag pa'i gnas skabs na ni shin tu dmigs pa med pa kho na ste /
translated: In the concentrated state, however, there is absolutely no apprehension.

original: de'i tshe na ni sbyin pa la sogs par 'jug par khas mi len gyi /
analyzed: de'i tshe na ni sbyin pa la sogs par 'jug par khas mi len gyi /
translated: At that time, one does not accept the engagement in generosity, etc.

original: dang po sbyor ba'i gnas skabs sam //
analyzed: dang po sbyor ba'i gnas skabs sam //
translated: First, in the stage of preparation,

original: langs pa rnams la bya bas klan kar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: langs pa rnams la bya bas klan kar mi rung ngo //
translated: and second, in the stage of standing in the fruit, it is not proper to find fault with the bodhisattva.

original: 'dis ni 'bras bu che ba'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa la sbyor ba'i rgya che ba brjod do //
analyzed: 'dis ni 'bras bu che ba'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa la sbyor ba'i rgya che ba brjod do //
translated: This shows the greatness of the perfection of giving, because of its great fruit.

original: kun rdzob tu rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po nye bar ston pas skur pa 'debs pa'i mtha' bkag par yang gyur to //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po nye bar ston pas skur pa 'debs pa'i mtha' bkag par yang gyur to //
translated: And it shows the greatness of the perfection of giving, because it avoids the extreme of nihilism, since it shows the reality of cause and effect in the conventional sense.

original: rnam pa gsum gyis na bsod nams nam mkha' dang mtshungs pa yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa gsum gyis na bsod nams nam mkha' dang mtshungs pa yin te /
translated: Giving is like space in three ways:

original: thams cad du song ba dang / rgya che ba dang / mi zad pas so //üîΩ'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bsod nams bskyed pas thams cad du song ba ste /
analyzed: thams cad du song ba dang / rgya che ba dang / mi zad pas so // 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bsod nams bskyed pas thams cad du song ba ste /
translated: it is omnipresent, vast, and inexhaustible.üîΩIt is omnipresent, since it generates mundane and supramundane merit.üîΩMundane merit is generated in the non-concentrated state,

original: 'jig rten pa'i bsod nams ni mnyam par ma gzhag pa'i gnas skabs bskyed do //üîΩ'jig rten las 'das pa ni mnyam par bzhag pa'i gnas skabs so //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i bsod nams ni mnyam par ma gzhag pa'i gnas skabs bskyed do // 'jig rten las 'das pa ni mnyam par bzhag pa'i gnas skabs so //
translated: and supramundane merit is generated in the concentrated state.

original: khyad zhugs par khyad par du 'gro bas rgya che ba'o //
analyzed: khyad zhugs par khyad par du 'gro bas rgya che ba'o //
translated: It is vast, since it is superior and becomes more and more superior.

original: 'khor ba ji srid kyi bar du yongs su gtugs par mi 'gyur bas mi zad pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor ba ji srid kyi bar du yongs su gtugs par mi 'gyur bas mi zad pa'o //
translated: It is inexhaustible because it is not exhausted until the end of cyclic existence.

original: gal te de med pa'i phyir gzugs la mi gnas pa sbyin pa sbyin par bya na de'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' de bzhin gshegs pa'i gzugs kyi sku thob par 'dod pas sbyin pa la sogs pa la ji ltar 'jug par bya zhes brgal du dogs nas /
analyzed: gal te de med pa'i phyir gzugs la mi gnas pa sbyin pa sbyin par bya na de'i tshe byang chub sems dpa' de bzhin gshegs pa'i gzugs kyi sku thob par 'dod pas sbyin pa la sogs pa la ji ltar 'jug par bya zhes brgal du dogs nas /
translated: If one gives a gift without relying on form, because it does not exist, then how can the bodhisattva who desires to attain the form body of the Tathagata engage in generosity and so forth?

original: rab 'byor 'di ji snyam du sems zhes bya ba la sogs pas gzugs @220b kyi sku thob par 'dun pa'i gnas ston te /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di ji snyam du sems zhes bya ba la sogs pas gzugs @220b kyi sku thob par 'dun pa'i gnas ston te /
translated: In order to respond to this objection, the passage beginning with ‚ÄúWhat do you think, Subhuti?‚Äù teaches the basis for the aspiration to attain the form body.

original: 'dir don gyis na gzugs kyi sku la de bzhin gshegs par mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyi mtshan nyid mi mthun pa'i phyogs sel to //
analyzed: 'dir don gyis na gzugs kyi sku la de bzhin gshegs par mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyi mtshan nyid mi mthun pa'i phyogs sel to //
translated: Here, by implication, the counteragent that is the pride of regarding the form body as the Tathagata is eliminated.

original: mtshan phun sum tshogs pa zhes mtshan ma tsam zhig yongs su brjod pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i gzugs kyi sku mtshan dang dpe byad bzang pos brgyan pa mtha' dag yongs su ston to //
analyzed: mtshan phun sum tshogs pa zhes mtshan ma tsam zhig yongs su brjod pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i gzugs kyi sku mtshan dang dpe byad bzang pos brgyan pa mtha' dag yongs su ston to //
translated: By merely mentioning the ‚Äúperfect major and minor marks,‚Äù the entire form body of the Tathagata, adorned with the major and minor marks, is taught.

original: de la mtshan rnams ni phyag dang zhabs la 'khor lo mnga' ba la sogs pa sum cu rtsa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la mtshan rnams ni phyag dang zhabs la 'khor lo mnga' ba la sogs pa sum cu rtsa gnyis te /
translated: The marks are the thirty-two marks of a great person, such as having feet with wheels, and so on.üîΩFearing too many words, I will not write about them, so you should understand them as they appear in the sutras.

original: tshig mangs kyis dogs bas ma bris kyi mdo las ji skad 'byung ba bzhin du khong du chud par gyis shig / de dag kyang yul na gnas pa dang / gsal ba dang / rdzogs pas phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: tshig mangs kyis dogs bas ma bris kyi mdo las ji skad 'byung ba bzhin du khong du chud par gyis shig / de dag kyang yul na gnas pa dang / gsal ba dang / rdzogs pas phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: They are also perfect in terms of abiding in a place, being clear, and being complete.

original: dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu dag ni sen mo zangs kyi mdog 'dra ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: dpe byad bzang po brgyad cu dag ni sen mo zangs kyi mdog 'dra ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The eighty minor marks are such things as having fingernails the color of copper.üîΩYou should understand them as they appear in the sutras.

original: mdo las 'byung ba bzhin du shes par gyis shig / mtshan la sogs pa de dag kyang sgyu mas sprul pa'i sangs rgyas kyi mtshan bzhin du brdzun pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mdo las 'byung ba bzhin du shes par gyis shig / mtshan la sogs pa de dag kyang sgyu mas sprul pa'i sangs rgyas kyi mtshan bzhin du brdzun pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Those marks and so on are false, like the marks of a buddha emanated by an illusion.

original: de bas na gzugs kyi sku rnam pa de lta bu la 'dun pa dang smon lam gyis gnas par bya'o zhes ston to //
analyzed: de bas na gzugs kyi sku rnam pa de lta bu la 'dun pa dang smon lam gyis gnas par bya'o zhes ston to //
translated: Therefore, it is taught that you should abide with aspiration and prayer for a form body of that kind.

original: 'di ltar mtshan de dag kyang rdul phra rab bsags pa'i ngo bo nyid dam /
analyzed: 'di ltar mtshan de dag kyang rdul phra rab bsags pa'i ngo bo nyid dam /
translated: In that case, those marks are either the nature of an accumulation of subtle particles,

original: des brtsams pa yan lag can gyi gzugs zhig tu gyur grang na /
analyzed: des brtsams pa yan lag can gyi gzugs zhig tu gyur grang na /
translated: If it is a whole, composed of parts,

original: re zhig phyogs dang po ni ma yin te /
analyzed: re zhig phyogs dang po ni ma yin te /
translated: then the first alternative is not so,

original: rdul phra rab rnams sngar bshig zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdul phra rab rnams sngar bshig zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the atoms have already been refuted.

original: gnyis pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: gnyis pa yang ma yin no //
translated: The second alternative is not so,

original: rtsom par byed pa med na des na brtsams pa yan lag can yang med pa'i phyir dang / sgrib pa la sogs pa 'gal ba'i chos sngar bshad pa dag dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtsom par byed pa med na des na brtsams pa yan lag can yang med pa'i phyir dang / sgrib pa la sogs pa 'gal ba'i chos sngar bshad pa dag dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because if there is no composer, then there is no composed whole, and because the previously explained contradictory properties of obstruction and so on are observed.

original: de'i phyir smras pa las dgongs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa las dgongs pa gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, the statement is one that requires interpretation.

original: de la brtags nas rab 'byor gyis /
analyzed: de la brtags nas rab 'byor gyis /
translated: Having examined that, Subh≈´ti

original: de ni ma lags te zhes gsal to //
analyzed: de ni ma lags te zhes gsal to //
translated: clearly said, ‚ÄúNo, Blessed One.‚Äù

original: gal te mtshan rnams brdzun pa nyid yin na 'o na bcom ldan 'das kyis mdo sde de dang de dag slas mtshan rnams gsungs snyam du bsams shing /
analyzed: gal te mtshan rnams brdzun pa nyid yin na 'o na bcom ldan 'das kyis mdo sde de dang de dag slas mtshan rnams gsungs snyam du bsams shing /
translated: If the marks are false, then why did the Blessed One teach those and those s≈´tras that teach the marks?üîΩThinking this, he asked, ‚ÄúWhy is that?‚Äù

original: de ci'i slad du zhes dris pa dang / de nyid mtshan phun sum tshogs pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhes dris pa dang / de nyid mtshan phun sum tshogs pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: It was said, ‚ÄúBecause the perfection of marks does not exist.‚Äù

original: mtshan phun sum tshogs pa de don dam par gsungs pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: mtshan phun sum tshogs pa de don dam par gsungs pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: The perfection of the marks is not taught as ultimate,

original: sgyu mas sprul pa'i sangs rgyas bzhin du des brdzun pa'i ngo bo kho nar gsungs so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //üîΩ'phags @221a * //
analyzed: sgyu mas sprul pa'i sangs rgyas bzhin du des brdzun pa'i ngo bo kho nar gsungs so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // 'phags @221a * //
translated: but rather as the nature of falsity, like a Buddha emanation.

original: pa rab 'byor gyis smras pa'i don de nyid bcom ldan 'das kyis bskang ba'i phyir ji tsam du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: pa rab 'byor gyis smras pa'i don de nyid bcom ldan 'das kyis bskang ba'i phyir ji tsam du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: The Lord, in order to confirm the meaning of what was said by the noble Subh≈´ti, said,üîΩ‚ÄúTo the extent that there is perfection of the marks, to that extent there is a false perfection of the marks.‚Äù

original: ji tsam du mtshan phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya ba ni don dam par ni ji tsam du mtshan phun sum tshogs par mngon par zhen pa de tsam du log par mngon par zhen pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ji tsam du mtshan phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya ba ni don dam par ni ji tsam du mtshan phun sum tshogs par mngon par zhen pa de tsam du log par mngon par zhen pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: To the extent that there is perfection of the marks, to that extent there is a false perfection of the marks.üîΩThis is the meaning of what was said by the noble Subh≈´ti.

original: sngar ji skad bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: sngar ji skad bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: As was previously taught,üîΩto the extent that there is no perfection of the marks, to that extent there is a perfection of the marks.

original: ji tsam du mtshan phun sum tshogs pa med pa zhes bya ba ni bzlog ste bshad par khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: ji tsam du mtshan phun sum tshogs pa med pa zhes bya ba ni bzlog ste bshad par khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: This should be understood as the opposite of what was previously taught.

original: 'dis ni 'di la rnal 'byor la snyoms par 'jug pas ji ltar bsgrub par bya ba de bstan to ;
analyzed: 'dis ni 'di la rnal 'byor la snyoms par 'jug pas ji ltar bsgrub par bya ba de bstan to ;
translated: This shows how one should practice here by entering into the yoga.

original: /'di la ji ltar mtha' gnyis spangs nas sems rab tu gzung bar bya ba de ston te /
analyzed: /'di la ji ltar mtha' gnyis spangs nas sems rab tu gzung bar bya ba de ston te /
translated: This shows how one should hold the mind by avoiding the two extremes.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ni sgyu mas sprul pa'i sangs rgyas bzhin du mtshan gyis de bzhin gshegs pa blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ni sgyu mas sprul pa'i sangs rgyas bzhin du mtshan gyis de bzhin gshegs pa blta bar bya'o //
translated: As it is means that one should see the Tathagata as having the marks, like a Buddha emanated by magic.

original: 'dis ni skur ba 'debs pa'i mtha' sel te /
analyzed: 'dis ni skur ba 'debs pa'i mtha' sel te /
translated: This removes the extreme of denial,

original: kun rdzob tu bcom ldan 'das kyi gzugs kyi sku la skur pa mi 'debs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu bcom ldan 'das kyi gzugs kyi sku la skur pa mi 'debs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one does not deny the conventional existence of the Blessed One's body of form.

original: mtshan med pa ni don dam par blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: mtshan med pa ni don dam par blta bar bya ste /
translated: One should see him as without marks in the ultimate sense,

original: mtshan gang yang grub pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtshan gang yang grub pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because no mark is established.

original: 'dis ni sgro btags pa'i mtha' bsal to //
analyzed: 'dis ni sgro btags pa'i mtha' bsal to //
translated: This removes the extreme of fabrication.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gzugs kyi sku thob par bya ba'i phyir smon lam 'debs pas ni rgya che ba brjod do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gzugs kyi sku thob par bya ba'i phyir smon lam 'debs pas ni rgya che ba brjod do //
translated: The extensive is expressed by the aspiration to attain the Tathagata's body of form.

original: de mi dmigs pas ni zab pa'o //
analyzed: de mi dmigs pas ni zab pa'o //
translated: The profound is by the nonapprehension of that.

original: gzugs kyi sku thob par 'dun pa'i gnas bshad zin to //
analyzed: gzugs kyi sku thob par 'dun pa'i gnas bshad zin to //
translated: The explanation of the basis of the aspiration to attain the form body is finished.

original: chos kyi sku ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: chos kyi sku ni rnam pa gnyis te /

original: kun rdzob tu ni bsod nams kyi phung po gnas pa nyid de /
analyzed: kun rdzob tu ni bsod nams kyi phung po gnas pa nyid de /

analyzed: de lta bas na /

analyzed: de ltar 'phags pa rab 'byor gyis mtha' gnyis bkag ste /
translated: Thus, the noble Subh≈´ti refutes the two extremes.

original: de'i 'og tu 'khor rnams chos rgya chen po nyan pa'i 'os su gyur pa dang / des kyang bsod nams ches mang bar brjod pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu 'khor rnams chos rgya chen po nyan pa'i 'os su gyur pa dang / des kyang bsod nams ches mang bar brjod pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis /

analyzed: rab 'byor gang gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa bka' stsal to //

original: 'dis ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis rtogs pa'i chos kyi sku bsod nams kyi rgyu can de bshad pa'i chos kyi sku las nges par 'byung bas re zhig de las /

analyzed: tshig bzhi pa'i tshigs su bcad pa tsam bstan na yang de ltar bsod nams kyi skye mched du gyur pa yin na de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis rtogs pa'i chos kyi sku bsod nams kyi rgyu can de lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes de skad ston to //

original: des na don dam par chos bstan pa'am /

analyzed: bsod nams khyad zhugs par bstan pa 'dis ni 'di'i rgya che ba bstan to //

analyzed: 'chad ces bya ba ni tshig go //

original: yang dag par ston zhes bya ba ni don to //üîΩgrangs med ces bya ba ni rab tu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag par ston zhes bya ba ni don to // grangs med ces bya ba ni rab tu med pa'i phyir ro //

original: dpag tu med ces bya ba ni dpe'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dpag tu med ces bya ba ni dpe'i yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro //

original: 'dis ni don gyis na bsod nams mi skyed pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs rab tu sel to //
analyzed: 'dis ni don gyis na bsod nams mi skyed pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs rab tu sel to //
translated: This shows the benefit of the perfection of wisdom, which is the removal of the counteragent to the non-production of merit.

original: bsod nams zhes mtshan tsam zhig brjod pas ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i bsod nams kyi tshogs mtha' dag ston to //üîΩ'di ci yid ches par bya bar zad dam /

original: 'on te rigs pas shes par bya ba yang yin snyam du sems shing /
analyzed: 'on te rigs pas shes par bya ba yang yin snyam du sems shing /
translated: One might think, Is this to be believed or is it to be understood by reasoning?

original: de ci'i slad du zhes zhus pa dang / 'dir rab 'byor de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ni 'di las byung ste zhes rigs pa bka' stsal to //

translated: Therefore, it is asked, Why is it so? And here the reasoning is stated: Subhuti, the unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment of the Tathagatas, Arhats, Perfectly Awakened Ones arises from this.

original: 'di snyam du bsod nams ches zhes bya ba de yang 'bras bu che ba'i phyir bsod nams che ba yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di snyam du bsod nams ches zhes bya ba de yang 'bras bu che ba'i phyir bsod nams che ba yin gyi /

original: chos kyi sbyin pas ni de bzhin gshegs @227b pa'i go 'phang dpe med cing zad mi shes pa thob pas ci'i phyir chen po nyid du mi mngon /
analyzed: chos kyi sbyin pas ni de bzhin gshegs @227b pa'i go 'phang dpe med cing zad mi shes pa thob pas ci'i phyir chen po nyid du mi mngon /

translated: Thus, by the process of teaching it to others, one attains the state of a Buddha quickly, not by means of the jewels.

original: de lta bas na gzhan dag la phan 'dogs pa'i mchog tu gyur pas rin po che sbyin pa las chos kyi sbyin pa khyad par du 'phags so snyam du dgongs pa yin no //

original: 'di las 'byung zhes bya ba ni yang dag par grub pa ste /

original: don dam par ni byang chub dang / sangs rgyas rnams tha dad pa med do //
analyzed: don dam par ni byang chub dang / sangs rgyas rnams tha dad pa med do //
translated: But ultimately, enlightenment and the Buddhas are not different.

analyzed: bsod nams khyad par du 'phags par bstan pa 'dis ni de bskyed bar 'dun pa dang / smon lam gyis gnas par bya ba bstan pa yin no //

original: gal te don dam par chos thams cad ma skyes pa kho na yin na de'i tshe sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad kyang ma skyes pa kho nar 'gyur na ji ltar bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'di las 'byung /

translated: If ultimately all things are just non-arisen, then all the qualities of the Buddha would be just non-arisen. How then could they arise from this unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment?

analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams ni byang chub dang tha dad pa med do snyam du sems shing /

analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhes zhus pa dang / 'dir lan du sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams zhes bya ba gsungs so //

analyzed: sangs rgyas su gdags pa'i rgyu can bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi chos rnams ni sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams so //
translated: The qualities of the Buddha are the qualities characterized by unsurpassed perfect enlightenment and so on, which are the causes for designating the Buddha.

original: de'i phyir sangs rgyas rnams ni don dam par byang chub dang tha dad pa med med kyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir sangs rgyas rnams ni don dam par byang chub dang tha dad pa med med kyi /

analyzed: de gdags pa'i rgyur gyur pas sangs rgyas rnams ni 'di las skyes par gsungs so zhes @228a * //

analyzed: dgongs pa'o // de dag kyang don dam par ma skyes pa'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams med kyang kun rdzob la brten nas de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ni 'di las byung zhes bya ba la sogs pa de bzhin
translated: Also, because they are ultimately unborn, it is said, The qualities of the Buddha do not exist, but in dependence on the conventional, the unsurpassed perfect enlightenment of the tathƒÅgatas arises from this.

original: gshegs pas gsungs te /
analyzed: gshegs pas gsungs te /
translated: The Exalted One has said this,

original: don dam par ni ma yin no //
analyzed: don dam par ni ma yin no //
translated: but not ultimately.

analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir phyogs gzhan de dang de las sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams zhes bya ba'i don dam par ni brjod par mi nus te /
translated: Therefore, in this and that other context, the term ‚Äúqualities of a Buddha‚Äù cannot be expressed ultimately,

analyzed: de so so rang gi rig par bya ba yin pas brjod du med pa'i phyir ro snyam du dgongs pa'o //

original: 'dis ni rnal 'byor du snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par g-yeng ba tshar bcad pa bstan te /
analyzed: 'dis ni rnal 'byor du snyoms par 'jug pa dang / rnam par g-yeng ba tshar bcad pa bstan te /
translated: This shows the meditative concentration of yoga and the destruction of distraction.

original: zab pa yang bstan to //

analyzed: 'dir la la dag na re chos kyi sku tha dad pa med pa'i phyir sku tha dad pa rnam pa gsum po 'di ji ltar 'gyur /

translated: Or else, since it is the attainment of the Dharma Body and is the natural outcome of the Dharma Body, the nature of merit and the nature of explanation are described as the Dharma Body in an analogical sense.

translated: In that case, the form body would be the reality body, because it is the natural outcome of the attainment of the reality body and because it is the cause of the attainment of the reality body.

original: de ni bden pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni bden pa ma yin te /
translated: This is not so.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi chos kyi sku ni yongs su dag pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin dang / de'i spyi'i chos nyid gang yin pa de la rnam par gzhag go //

translated: The reality body of the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, is the nature of completely purified intuition and the universal nature of that intuition.

original: 'di ni 'di'i rnam par smin pa'i dbye ba yang ma yin pa bshad pa dang bsod nams dag la btags nas 'dir chos zhes bstan pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni 'di'i rnam par smin pa'i dbye ba yang ma yin pa bshad pa dang bsod nams dag la btags nas 'dir chos zhes bstan pa yang ma yin no //

analyzed: 'o na ji lta bu zhe na /

original: dngos po kho na ste /
analyzed: dngos po kho na ste /
translated: It is the real thing itself.

original: chos ston to //
analyzed: chos ston to //
translated: The reality body is the teaching of the Dharma.

original: chos stsogs so zhes bya ba la sogs pa bdag nyid kyis de ltar grags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos stsogs so zhes bya ba la sogs pa bdag nyid kyis de ltar grags pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: gang yang rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid 'dzin pas chos rnams so zhes bstan pa de ni dngos po thams cad dang thun mong yin pas gzugs kyi sku ni de bzhin gshegs par ma bstan te /
translated: Since it is taught that phenomena are all those that apprehend their own and general characteristics, the Dharma Body is not taught to be the TathƒÅgata, because it is common to all things.

original: shes par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: btags nas bstan du zin kyang gzugs kyi sku ni chos kyi skur thal bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: Even though it is taught by imputation, the form body does not follow as the Dharma Body,

original: de ni bsod nams kyis rgyu mthun pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni bsod nams kyis rgyu mthun pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the natural outcome of merit.

original: de skad du /
analyzed: de skad du /

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyi gzugs sku ni //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi gzugs sku ni //

original: bsod nams tshogs las byung ba'o //üîΩzhes bshad do //
analyzed: bsod nams tshogs las byung ba'o // zhes bshad do //

analyzed: 'on kyang rmi lam na dmigs pa'i zhing bkod pa bzhin du ma brtags na dga' ba tsam du kun rdzob tu yod par gsungs te /
translated: Nevertheless, like the arrangement of a field perceived in a dream, they are said to exist conventionally, as mere pleasure when not investigated.

original: de nyid kyi phyir zhing bkod pa rnams zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir zhing bkod pa rnams zhes bya'o //
translated: For that very reason, they are called ‚Äúarrangements of a field.‚Äù

original: de lta ma yin na don dam pa'i rang bzhin ni brjod par mi nus pas brjod par mi 'gyur ro snyam du @232a * //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na don dam pa'i rang bzhin ni brjod par mi nus pas brjod par mi 'gyur ro snyam du @232a * //
translated: Otherwise, since the nature of the ultimate cannot be expressed, it would not be expressed.üîΩThis is the thought.

original: dgongs pa'o // mi gnas pa gong du yang bshad mod kyi /
analyzed: dgongs pa'o // mi gnas pa gong du yang bshad mod kyi /
translated: Although non-abiding has been explained above,

original: brjed ngas pa'i tshul can dag la phan gdags pa'i don du /
analyzed: brjed ngas pa'i tshul can dag la phan gdags pa'i don du /
translated: in order to benefit those who are forgetful,

original: mjug bsdu ba'i thabs kyis dran par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: mjug bsdu ba'i thabs kyis dran par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: in order to remind them by the method of a concluding summary,

original: de lta bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de lta bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: he says ‚ÄúTherefore‚Äù and so on.

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba ni ji skad smos pa'i rnam pas dngos po gang yang grub pa med pa'i phyir de la mi gnas par sems bskyed par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba ni ji skad smos pa'i rnam pas dngos po gang yang grub pa med pa'i phyir de la mi gnas par sems bskyed par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Thus, since no thing whatsoever is established in the manner stated, one should generate the thought without abiding in that. This is the meaning.

original: lhag ma ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: lhag ma ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The rest is as before.

original: de la mi bden par smra ba'o zhes bya ba 'dis ni don gyis na don dam par bdag gis zhing bkod pa bsgrub bo snyam du mngon par zhen pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs su yongs su ston te /
analyzed: de la mi bden par smra ba'o zhes bya ba 'dis ni don gyis na don dam par bdag gis zhing bkod pa bsgrub bo snyam du mngon par zhen pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs su yongs su ston te /
translated: In this regard, the statement ‚Äúone should not speak falsely‚Äù indicates the resistance in terms of the ultimate, i.e., the thought ‚ÄúI will accomplish the array of the buddha-field.‚Äù

original: zhing bkod pa rnams zhes mtshan ma tsam zhig brjod pas dmigs pa chung ngu yid la byed pa sgom pa thams cad dang bral bar yongs su ston to //
analyzed: zhing bkod pa rnams zhes mtshan ma tsam zhig brjod pas dmigs pa chung ngu yid la byed pa sgom pa thams cad dang bral bar yongs su ston to //
translated: By mentioning just the sign ‚Äúarray of the buddha-field,‚Äù he indicates the cultivation of the mental attention to a limited objective support, i.e., the absence of all cultivation.

original: dmigs pa chung ngu yid la byed pa sgom pa la 'dun pa dang smon lam gdab pa yang ston to //
analyzed: dmigs pa chung ngu yid la byed pa sgom pa la 'dun pa dang smon lam gdab pa yang ston to //
translated: He also indicates the aspiration and the vow with regard to the cultivation of the mental attention to a limited objective support.

original: bkod pa de dag med par de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs zhes bya ba 'dis ni don dam pa rnam par 'jog pas rnal 'byor du snyoms par 'jug pa la 'dzud de zab pa ston to //üîΩdes na zhing bkod pa rnams zhes bya'o zhes bya ba 'dis ni skur ba 'debs pa'i mtha' bkag nas rnam par g-yeng ba tshar gcod pa ston te /
analyzed: bkod pa de dag med par de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs zhes bya ba 'dis ni don dam pa rnam par 'jog pas rnal 'byor du snyoms par 'jug pa la 'dzud de zab pa ston to // des na zhing bkod pa rnams zhes bya'o zhes bya ba 'dis ni skur ba 'debs pa'i mtha' bkag nas rnam par g-yeng ba tshar gcod pa ston te /
translated: The phrase the Tathagata has said that those arrays do not exist introduces the yoga of meditative equipoise by way of the establishment of the ultimate, and it teaches the profundity of the Dharma.

original: gnas 'di'i rgya che ba yongs su ston to //
analyzed: gnas 'di'i rgya che ba yongs su ston to //
translated: The phrase therefore, they are called the arrays of the buddha-field teaches the elimination of distraction by refuting the extreme of deprecation, and it teaches the vastness of this subject.

original: phung po rnams las sems can gud na med du zin kyang tha mi dad pa zhig yod pa kho na ma yin nam gzhan du na byang chub sems dpa' sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir ji ltar 'jug snyam du gang sems pa de sems can
analyzed: phung po rnams las sems can gud na med du zin kyang tha mi dad pa zhig yod pa kho na ma yin nam gzhan du na byang chub sems dpa' sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir ji ltar 'jug snyam du gang sems pa de sems can
translated: Although sentient beings do not exist apart from the aggregates, they are not simply non-different from them. Otherwise, how could the bodhisattva engage in the ripening of sentient beings?

original: yal bar 'dor ba'i mtshan nyid gags su 'gyur ba dbral ba'i phyir gnas brgyad pa'i dbang du mdzad nas 'di lta ste dper na zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: yal bar 'dor ba'i mtshan nyid gags su 'gyur ba dbral ba'i phyir gnas brgyad pa'i dbang du mdzad nas 'di lta ste dper na zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: In order to remove the characteristic of abandonment, in terms of the eighth topic, it is said, For example...

original: skyes bu zhig zhes bya ba ni lha ma yin gyi dbang po sgra gcan zin te /
analyzed: skyes bu zhig zhes bya ba ni lha ma yin gyi dbang po sgra gcan zin te /
translated: A certain man refers to Rahula, the lord of the asuras.

original: de'i lus ni 'dod pa'i khams na ri rab kyi tshad tsam mo //
analyzed: de'i lus ni 'dod pa'i khams na ri rab kyi tshad tsam mo //
translated: His body, in the desire realm, is the size of Mount Sumeru.

original: de cher zin kyang don med par de'i chen po ste /
analyzed: de cher zin kyang don med par de'i chen po ste /
translated: Although it is large, it is useless, that largeness.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis ci'i phyir bstan pa'i dgongs pa brjod par 'dod pas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis ci'i phyir bstan pa'i dgongs pa brjod par 'dod pas /
translated: The Blessed One, wishing to explain the intention of the teaching,üîΩasks, Why is that?

original: de ci'i slad du zhes dris pa dang / dgongs pa de nyid brjod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhes dris pa dang / dgongs pa de nyid brjod pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to express that very intention,

original: dngos po ma mchis pa zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: dngos po ma mchis pa zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: non-entity is stated.

original: don dam par gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin dang bral ba'i phyir ngo bo nyid med pa kho na ste /
analyzed: don dam par gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin dang bral ba'i phyir ngo bo nyid med pa kho na ste /
translated: Ultimately, it is only devoid of inherent nature, because it is free from the nature of one and many.

original: rmi lam dag na rmis pa'i lus @232b bzhin du de ni kun rdzob bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs kyi don dam par ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rmi lam dag na rmis pa'i lus @232b bzhin du de ni kun rdzob bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs kyi don dam par ni ma yin no //
translated: Just like a body that is dreamed about in a dream, it is said by the TathƒÅgata to be conventional, not ultimate.üîΩTherefore, it is called a body.

original: des na lus zhes bgyi'o zhes bya ba ni 'dir 'thad pa smras pa'o //
analyzed: des na lus zhes bgyi'o zhes bya ba ni 'dir 'thad pa smras pa'o //
translated: This is the argument he presents here.

original: 'di ltar 'di ni kun rdzob nyid de de'i phyir de skad ces bya'i de lta ma yin na don dam par chos gang yang grub pa med pa'i phyir de skad mi brjod do zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di ni kun rdzob nyid de de'i phyir de skad ces bya'i de lta ma yin na don dam par chos gang yang grub pa med pa'i phyir de skad mi brjod do zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: It is like this: it is conventional, and therefore it is called that. If it were not so, then it would not be called that, because no phenomenon is established ultimately.

original: rgyal dbog pa la sogs pa gang dag med pa la dngos por khas len pa de dag dgag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rgyal dbog pa la sogs pa gang dag med pa la dngos por khas len pa de dag dgag pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to refute those who accept as real such things as the anointment of a king, which do not exist,

original: de dngos po ma mchis pas zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de dngos po ma mchis pas zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: he says, ‚Äúbecause it is unreal.‚Äù

original: dngos po med pa ni dngos po spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid yin pas ji ltar de dang mi mthun pa'i ngo bor mi 'gyur /
analyzed: dngos po med pa ni dngos po spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid yin pas ji ltar de dang mi mthun pa'i ngo bor mi 'gyur /
translated: Since unreality is the characteristic of the negation of reality, how could it not be a different nature?

original: de'i phyir lus zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir lus zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called a body.

original: de lta ma yin na don dam par lus gang yang grub pa med pas lus zhes bya ba 'dir ci zhig brjod de de'i phyir dngos po med par bstan pa 'dis ni 'di yongs su bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na don dam par lus gang yang grub pa med pas lus zhes bya ba 'dir ci zhig brjod de de'i phyir dngos po med par bstan pa 'dis ni 'di yongs su bstan pa yin te /
translated: Otherwise, since no body at all is ultimately established, what is this so-called body? Therefore, this teaching on the absence of things indicates this:

original: lus kyi tshad ri rab tsam gang yin pa yang gang gi tshe don dam par ngo bo nyid med pas bdag nyid kyi lus ma yin pa de'i tshe ji ltar gzhan dag gi lus ngo bo nyid dang bcas pa'am bdag dang bcas par 'gyur /
analyzed: lus kyi tshad ri rab tsam gang yin pa yang gang gi tshe don dam par ngo bo nyid med pas bdag nyid kyi lus ma yin pa de'i tshe ji ltar gzhan dag gi lus ngo bo nyid dang bcas pa'am bdag dang bcas par 'gyur /
translated: When even a body the size of Mount Meru is not one‚Äôs own body because it has no ultimate essence, how could the bodies of others have an essence or a self?

original: 'di la don gyis na byang chub sems dpa' sems can yongs su smin par bya ba la brtson pa don dam par sems can du mngon par zhen pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs su ston te /
analyzed: 'di la don gyis na byang chub sems dpa' sems can yongs su smin par bya ba la brtson pa don dam par sems can du mngon par zhen pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs su ston te /
translated: In this regard, the ultimate clinging to sentient beings is taught to be a factor incompatible with the bodhisattvas‚Äô striving to bring sentient beings to full maturity.

original: de spang bar bya ba'i 'dun pa dang / smon lam gdab pa yang bstan to //
analyzed: de spang bar bya ba'i 'dun pa dang / smon lam gdab pa yang bstan to //
translated: The aspiration to abandon that and the prayer to abandon that are also taught.

original: skyes bu zhig ces bya ba mtshan ma tsam zhig brjod pas sgo nga las skyes pa la sogs pa lus so so tha dad pa thams cad gzung bar brjod do //
analyzed: skyes bu zhig ces bya ba mtshan ma tsam zhig brjod pas sgo nga las skyes pa la sogs pa lus so so tha dad pa thams cad gzung bar brjod do //
translated: The phrase a certain person refers to the mere mark, and all the different bodies of those born from eggs, etc. are referred to by the word grasped.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas de dngos po ma mchis pa gsungs so zhes bya ba 'dis ni don dam par rnam par 'jog cing de la rnal 'byor du snyoms par 'jug pa'i gnas yongs su ston to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas de dngos po ma mchis pa gsungs so zhes bya ba 'dis ni don dam par rnam par 'jog cing de la rnal 'byor du snyoms par 'jug pa'i gnas yongs su ston to //
translated: The phrase the Tathagata has said that it does not exist shows the ultimate establishment and the basis for the meditative practice of yoga.

original: zab pa yang brjod do //
analyzed: zab pa yang brjod do //
translated: It is also said to be profound.

original: de dngos po ma mchis pas zhes bya ba 'dis ni g-yeng ba tshar gcod pa ston to //
analyzed: de dngos po ma mchis pas zhes bya ba 'dis ni g-yeng ba tshar gcod pa ston to //
translated: The phrase because it does not exist shows the elimination of distraction.

original: da ni chos kyi rnam grangs 'dis shin tu don che bar brjod pas phyi'i bstan bcos la mngon par zhen pa rnams de la rjes su chags pa rnam par g-yeng ba dang dbral ba'i phyir gnas dgu pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: da ni chos kyi rnam grangs 'dis shin tu don che bar brjod pas phyi'i bstan bcos la mngon par zhen pa rnams de la rjes su chags pa rnam par g-yeng ba dang dbral ba'i phyir gnas dgu pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: Now, in order to show that this Dharma-discourse is of great value, in order to free those who are attached to external treatises from the distraction of attachment to them, the Lord, in the ninth stage,

original: rab 'byor 'di ji snyam du sems zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di ji snyam du sems zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: says, What do you think, Subhuti?

original: 'dis rnam pa bzhis chos kyi rnam grangs 'di'i khyad par yongs su ston to //
analyzed: 'dis rnam pa bzhis chos kyi rnam grangs 'di'i khyad par yongs su ston to //
translated: This shows the excellence of this Dharma discourse in four ways.

original: bsod nams yongs su sdud pa dang / lha la sogs pa rim gro byed pa dang / @233a * //
analyzed: bsod nams yongs su sdud pa dang / lha la sogs pa rim gro byed pa dang / @233a * //
translated: It shows the excellence of the accumulation of merit, the excellence of the service of the gods,

original: bya dka' ba byed pa /
analyzed: bya dka' ba byed pa /
translated: the excellence of the performance of difficult tasks,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa dang mtshungs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa dang mtshungs par byed pa'o //
translated: and the excellence of being equal to the Tathagatas and so forth.

original: de la bsod nams yongs su sdud pa ni gzhi de las bsod nams mang du bskyed ces gang gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: de la bsod nams yongs su sdud pa ni gzhi de las bsod nams mang du bskyed ces gang gsungs pa'o //
translated: Among them, the excellence of the accumulation of merit is stated in the passage: ‚ÄúFrom that basis, much merit is generated.‚Äù

original: lha la sogs pas rim gro byed pa ni /
analyzed: lha la sogs pas rim gro byed pa ni /
translated: The excellence of the service of the gods is stated in the passage:

original: sa phyogs de na mchod rten du gyur pa yin zhes gang gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: sa phyogs de na mchod rten du gyur pa yin zhes gang gsungs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat place becomes a stupa.‚ÄùüîΩThe excellence of the performance of difficult tasks is stated in the passage:

original: bya dka' ba byed pa ni de dag ngo mtshar rab dang ldan par 'gyur ro zhes gang gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: bya dka' ba byed pa ni de dag ngo mtshar rab dang ldan par 'gyur ro zhes gang gsungs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThey become endowed with great wonder.‚Äù

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa dang mtshungs par byed pa ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa dang mtshungs par byed pa ni /
translated: The excellence of being equal to the Tathagatas and so forth is stated in the passage:

original: sa phyogs de na ston pa'am bla ma lta bu gang yang rung ba gnas so zhes gang gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: sa phyogs de na ston pa'am bla ma lta bu gang yang rung ba gnas so zhes gang gsungs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn that place, either a teacher or a guru resides.‚Äù

original: de la rin po che'i sbyin pa'i bsod nams brjod pa khyad par rnam pa gnyis kyis khyad par du 'phags par yongs su bstan te /
analyzed: de la rin po che'i sbyin pa'i bsod nams brjod pa khyad par rnam pa gnyis kyis khyad par du 'phags par yongs su bstan te /
translated: The merit of the gift of jewels is shown to be superior by two kinds of distinctions:

original: dngos po'i khyad par dang zhing gi khyad par ro //üîΩdngos po'i khyad par du 'phags pa yang rgya che ba dang / gya nom pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po'i khyad par dang zhing gi khyad par ro // dngos po'i khyad par du 'phags pa yang rgya che ba dang / gya nom pa'o //
translated: distinctions of the thing given and distinctions of the field.üîΩThe distinction of the thing given is shown by its abundance and excellence.

original: de la rgya che ba ni gzhi'i bye brag gis rab tu mang ba ste /
analyzed: de la rgya che ba ni gzhi'i bye brag gis rab tu mang ba ste /
translated: Abundance is the great number of things given, as stated in the passage:

original: 'jig rten gyi khams de snyed cig ces gang gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams de snyed cig ces gang gsungs pa'o //
translated: ‚Äúas many as there are world systems.‚Äù

original: gya nom pa ni 'jig rten na shin du dkon par grags pa ste /
analyzed: gya nom pa ni 'jig rten na shin du dkon par grags pa ste /
translated: Excellence is the rarity of the things given in the world, as stated in the passage:

original: rin po che sna bdun gyis rab tu gang bar byas te zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: rin po che sna bdun gyis rab tu gang bar byas te zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: ‚Äúfilled with the seven jewels.‚Äù

original: zhing ni bdag dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan pas khyad par du 'phags pa'o //
analyzed: zhing ni bdag dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan pas khyad par du 'phags pa'o //
translated: The field is superior when it is endowed with the perfection of one‚Äôs own and others‚Äô aims.

original: de la gzhan gyi phun sum tshogs pa ni spang bar bya ba dang / blang bar bya ba'i don gzhan dag la phyin ci ma log par ston pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de la gzhan gyi phun sum tshogs pa ni spang bar bya ba dang / blang bar bya ba'i don gzhan dag la phyin ci ma log par ston pa'i phyir te /
translated: The excellence of others is the abandonment of what is to be abandoned and the demonstration to others of the unerring meaning of what is to be adopted.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: The TathƒÅgata is so called because he has spoken in accordance with reality.

original: de dngos po'i de kho na de ji lta ba bzhin du gsungs pas nges pa'i tshig tu na de bzhin du gsungs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dngos po'i de kho na de ji lta ba bzhin du gsungs pas nges pa'i tshig tu na de bzhin du gsungs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Since he has spoken in accordance with reality, he is called the TathƒÅgata in the sense of speaking in accordance with reality.

original: bdag gi don phun sum tshogs pa ni ye shes dang spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa tha dad pas rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: bdag gi don phun sum tshogs pa ni ye shes dang spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa tha dad pas rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The excellence of his own aim is twofold, the excellence of his knowledge and the excellence of his abandonment.

original: de la dgra bcom pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa bstan te /
analyzed: de la dgra bcom pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa bstan te /
translated: Among them, the word ‚Äúworthy one‚Äù indicates the excellence of his abandonment.

original: nyon mongs pa'i dgra bcom pas nges pa'i tshig tu na dgra bcom pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i dgra bcom pas nges pa'i tshig tu na dgra bcom pa zhes bya'o //
translated: He is called a ‚Äúworthy one‚Äù because he has abandoned the afflictions, which are his enemies.

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas zhes bya ba 'dis ni ye shes phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas zhes bya ba 'dis ni ye shes phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
translated: The word ‚Äúperfect buddha‚Äù indicates the excellence of his knowledge.

original: de'i phyir tshig gsum smos pa 'bras bu dang bcas pa yin no zhes spyir bsdu ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i phyir tshig gsum smos pa 'bras bu dang bcas pa yin no zhes spyir bsdu ba'i don to //
translated: Therefore, the three phrases are together with their results. This is the general meaning of the summary.

original: mos par bya zhes bya ba na 'dod pa ste /
analyzed: mos par bya zhes bya ba na 'dod pa ste /
translated: One should aspire means to desire.

original: mos pa bskyed par bya'o khong du chud par bya'o zhes bya ba ni rtogs par bya ba ste shes rab bskyed do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mos pa bskyed par bya'o khong du chud par bya'o zhes bya ba ni rtogs par bya ba ste shes rab bskyed do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: One should generate aspiration, one should understand means to realize, which is to say, to generate wisdom.

original: 'di la snga ma ni phyi ma'i @233b 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: 'di la snga ma ni phyi ma'i @233b 'bras bu'o //
translated: Here, the former is the result of the latter.

original: yang na phyi ma ni snga ma'i bshad pa'o //
analyzed: yang na phyi ma ni snga ma'i bshad pa'o //
translated: Or, the latter is the explanation of the former.

original: bshad ces bya ba ni sgra'o //
analyzed: bshad ces bya ba ni sgra'o //
translated: To explain is sound.

original: yang dag par bstan zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa ste mos pa bskyed pa'i don to //
analyzed: yang dag par bstan zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa ste mos pa bskyed pa'i don to //
translated: To demonstrate means to desire, which is to say, to generate aspiration.

original: grangs med ces bya ba ni grangs kyis yongs su gcad par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: grangs med ces bya ba ni grangs kyis yongs su gcad par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Incalculable means that it cannot be delimited by number.

original: dpag tu med ces bya ba ni mthu dpag par mi nus pa'am dpe med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dpag tu med ces bya ba ni mthu dpag par mi nus pa'am dpe med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Immeasurable means that its power cannot be measured or that it is without example.

original: 'don zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid yi ge kha ton du byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'don zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid yi ge kha ton du byed pa'o //
translated: To recite means to recite the syllables oneself.

original: ston zhes bya ba ni gzhan dag la tshig gi don yang dag par ston pa'o //
analyzed: ston zhes bya ba ni gzhan dag la tshig gi don yang dag par ston pa'o //
translated: The word teacher means one who correctly teaches the meaning of the words to others.

original: yang na 'don pa ni tshig go //
analyzed: yang na 'don pa ni tshig go //
translated: Alternatively, reciter means the words.

original: ston pa ni don to //
analyzed: ston pa ni don to //
translated: And teacher means the meaning.

original: mchod rten du gyur zhes bya ba ni phyag bya bar 'os pa'o //
analyzed: mchod rten du gyur zhes bya ba ni phyag bya bar 'os pa'o //
translated: The word shrine means one who is worthy of homage.

original: mchod rten nyid mchod rten du gyur pa ste /
analyzed: mchod rten nyid mchod rten du gyur pa ste /
translated: The shrine itself is the shrine.

original: dper na dbang du gyur ces bya ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na dbang du gyur ces bya ba bzhin no //

original: 'di ltar gang zag la bdag med pa tsam gyi tshigs su bcad pa bstan pas kyang mchod rten du gyur pa yin na bdag med pa gnyi ga bstan pa lta smos kyang ci dgos snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar gang zag la bdag med pa tsam gyi tshigs su bcad pa bstan pas kyang mchod rten du gyur pa yin na bdag med pa gnyi ga bstan pa lta smos kyang ci dgos snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: Thus, if one who teaches just the verse on the individual no self is a shrine, what need is there to mention one who teaches both forms of no self?

original: len pa zhes bya ba ni tshig go //
analyzed: len pa zhes bya ba ni tshig go //
translated: The word accepting means the words.

original: 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni mi brjed pa'o //
analyzed: 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni mi brjed pa'o //

original: klog ces bya ba ni glegs bam du byas pa'o //
analyzed: klog ces bya ba ni glegs bam du byas pa'o //

original: kun chub bar byed ces bya ba ni don to /
analyzed: kun chub bar byed ces bya ba ni don to /

original: 'dis ni thos pa la byung ba'i shes rab kyis 'dzin par bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni thos pa la byung ba'i shes rab kyis 'dzin par bstan to //
translated: This shows that one who has the wisdom that comes from listening holds the Dharma.

original: bsam pa dang bsam pa'i shes rab kyis kyang 'dzin pa'i phyir tshul bzhin zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: bsam pa dang bsam pa'i shes rab kyis kyang 'dzin pa'i phyir tshul bzhin zhes bya ba gsungs te /

analyzed: don phyin ci ma log par khong du chud ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //

analyzed: kha cig las ni 'dzin zhes bya ba'i tshig gcig po 'byung ste /

analyzed: de la 'dzin pa ni tshig dang don gnyi gar blta bar bya'o //

original: ngo mtshar rab ces bya ba ni chos zab cing rgya che ba rnam pa 'di lta bu khong du chud pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngo mtshar rab ces bya ba ni chos zab cing rgya che ba rnam pa 'di lta bu khong du chud pa'i phyir ro //

original: ston pa gnas zhes bya ba ni chos smra ba ste /
analyzed: ston pa gnas zhes bya ba ni chos smra ba ste /

original: ston pa'i mdzad pa mdzad pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: ston pa'i mdzad pa mdzad pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because he performs the deeds of the teacher,

original: de nyid sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mngon sum du bzhugs pa dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de nyid sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das mngon sum du bzhugs pa dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //

original: bla ma lta bu gang yang rung ba zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa 'jam pa'i dbyangs la sogs pa gang yang rung ba ste /
analyzed: bla ma lta bu gang yang rung ba zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa 'jam pa'i dbyangs la sogs pa gang yang rung ba ste /
translated: Any guru-like being means any being such as the noble Manjusri.üîΩ üîΩThe Dharma is present means the Dharma which is to be taught.

analyzed: de'i mdzad pa bsgrub pa'i phyir chos smra ba de gnas par blta'o //

original: kha cig las ni gzhan dang gzhan dag ces tshig gnyis 'byung ste /
analyzed: kha cig las ni gzhan dang gzhan dag ces tshig gnyis 'byung ste /

original: de ni bla ma lta bu gang yang rung thams cad kyi rnam grangs te /
analyzed: de ni bla ma lta bu gang yang rung thams cad kyi rnam grangs te /
translated: That is a synonym for any of those who are like a guru,

original: de na gnas zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de na gnas zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //

original: 'di thams cad kyis ni gnas 'di'i rgya che ba bstan to //
analyzed: 'di thams cad kyis ni gnas 'di'i rgya che ba bstan to //
translated: All of this teaches the vastness of this place.

original: don gyis na dam pa'i chos yongs su bzung ba btang nas phyi'i bstan bcos la rjes su chags pa mi mthun pa'i @234a * //üîΩphyogs su yongs su bstan te /
analyzed: don gyis na dam pa'i chos yongs su bzung ba btang nas phyi'i bstan bcos la rjes su chags pa mi mthun pa'i @234a * // phyogs su yongs su bstan te /
translated: In fact, it teaches the fault of being attached to external treatises after giving up the acceptance of the holy Dharma.

analyzed: de la rjes su chags pa yongs su btang la chos la brtson par bya ba la 'dun pa dang / smon lam btang ba bstan to //

analyzed: chos kyi rnam grangs 'di las zhes bya ba mtshan ma tsam zhig smos pas phyi'i bstan bcos la rjes su chags pa spangs te /
translated: It teaches the aspiration to give up attachment to external treatises by merely mentioning the name of this Dharma discourse.

analyzed: dam pa'i chos thams cad la brtson par bya'o zhes yongs su ston to //
translated: One should strive in all the holy Dharma.

original: chos kyi rnam grangs 'di nus pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang ldan pas gzhan la phan gdags pa'i don du ming thos pa tsam gyis kyang sems can rnams kyi bsod nams skye bar brjod pa'i phyir 'phags pa rab 'byor gyis 'di'i ming ci lags zhes zhus so
analyzed: chos kyi rnam grangs 'di nus pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang ldan pas gzhan la phan gdags pa'i don du ming thos pa tsam gyis kyang sems can rnams kyi bsod nams skye bar brjod pa'i phyir 'phags pa rab 'byor gyis 'di'i ming ci lags zhes zhus so
translated: Since this Dharma discourse has the inconceivable power to benefit others, even just hearing its name causes merit to arise for sentient beings. For this reason, the noble Subh≈´ti asks, ‚ÄúWhat is its name?‚Äù

original: // 'di ji ltar gzung bar bgyi zhes bya ba 'di ni bzung bas kyang bsod nams dpag tu med par 'gyur bar yongs su ston to //üîΩshes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba ni gang gi ming de yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //üîΩ'dis shes rab kyang yin la pha rol rtogs shing yongs su gcod pas pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: // 'di ji ltar gzung bar bgyi zhes bya ba 'di ni bzung bas kyang bsod nams dpag tu med par 'gyur bar yongs su ston to // shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba ni gang gi ming de yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o // 'dis shes rab kyang yin la pha rol rtogs shing yongs su gcod pas pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúHow should it be grasped?‚Äù shows that even by grasping it, immeasurable merit will arise.üîΩThe perfection of wisdom is so called because it is the perfection of wisdom.üîΩIt is wisdom because it is the perfection of wisdom.

original: de ni shes rab kyang yin la pha rol tu phyin pa yang yin na zhes bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: de ni shes rab kyang yin la pha rol tu phyin pa yang yin na zhes bsdu ba'o //
translated: It is the perfection of wisdom because it is the perfection of wisdom.

original: yang na shes rab kyi pha rol ni shes rab kyi pha rol te de 'dis rtogs shing yongs su gcod pas na de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: yang na shes rab kyi pha rol ni shes rab kyi pha rol te de 'dis rtogs shing yongs su gcod pas na de skad ces bya'o //
translated: Or else, the other shore of wisdom is the other shore of wisdom. It is so called because it is realized and completely discerned by this.

original: de yang shugs kyis na de bzhin gshegs pa'i shes rab rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: de yang shugs kyis na de bzhin gshegs pa'i shes rab rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa ste /

original: shes rab gzhan gyis na pha rol gzhal bar mi nus so //
analyzed: shes rab gzhan gyis na pha rol gzhal bar mi nus so //
translated: For, the other shore cannot be measured by any other wisdom.

original: yang na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni son to zhes bya ba'i tha tshig 'di nyid do //
analyzed: yang na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni son to zhes bya ba'i tha tshig 'di nyid do //
translated: Or else, the perfection of wisdom is the one that has gone to the other shore. This is the meaning of the expression.

original: de ni ji skad smos pa'i shes rab kho na ste /
analyzed: de ni ji skad smos pa'i shes rab kho na ste /
translated: It is just that wisdom as it has been described.

original: gzhan ni de'i pha rol tu 'gro mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan ni de'i pha rol tu 'gro mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For, it is impossible for any other to go to the other shore.

original: 'dis sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa yang bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa yang bshad pa yin no //

analyzed: de brjod par 'gyur bas chos kyi rnam grangs 'di la yang de skad ces bya ste /

original: rol rnyed ma phrogs pa la sogs pa snyan dngags sbyar ba bzhin no //
analyzed: rol rnyed ma phrogs pa la sogs pa snyan dngags sbyar ba bzhin no //
translated: Like the composition of poetry, such as the one that begins: ‚ÄúThe one who has stolen the maiden, etc.‚Äù

original: de ni bcom ldan 'das kyis so so rang gis rig par bya ba nyid yin pas thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir dang / de don dam par yang ma skyes pa'i phyir de sgras brjod mi srid do snyam du sems pa'i bsam pa las brtags nas de ci'i slad du zhes zhus pa dang /
analyzed: de ni bcom ldan 'das kyis so so rang gis rig par bya ba nyid yin pas thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir dang / de don dam par yang ma skyes pa'i phyir de sgras brjod mi srid do snyam du sems pa'i bsam pa las brtags nas de ci'i slad du zhes zhus pa dang /
translated: Having examined this thought, he asked, Why is that?

original: lan du rab 'byor de bzhin gshegs pas shes rab kyi rol tu phyin pa gang gsungs pa de zhes bya ba bka' stsal to //
analyzed: lan du rab 'byor de bzhin gshegs pas shes rab kyi rol tu phyin pa gang gsungs pa de zhes bya ba bka' stsal to //
translated: In reply, it was said, Subhuti, the perfection of wisdom that the Tathagata has spoken...

original: de @234b don dam pa so so rang gis rig par bya ba yin pas thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir dang / don dam par chos thams cad shin tu ma skyes pa'i phyir sgras brjod du mi rung mod kyi /
analyzed: de @234b don dam pa so so rang gis rig par bya ba yin pas thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir dang / don dam par chos thams cad shin tu ma skyes pa'i phyir sgras brjod du mi rung mod kyi /
translated: Since it is to be personally experienced by each one, it is not common, and since ultimately all phenomena are utterly unborn, it is indeed impossible to express it with words.

original: 'on kyang rnam par rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan gyi rang gi ngo bo la phyi rol tu sgro btags te /
analyzed: 'on kyang rnam par rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan gyi rang gi ngo bo la phyi rol tu sgro btags te /
translated: Nevertheless, superimposing external reality onto the nature of conceptual reflections,

analyzed: rnam par rtog pa de yang rang bzhin gyis 'khrul pa yin pas des sgro btags pa'i rnam pa de yang brdzun pa nyid do //
translated: Moreover, that conceptualization is by nature mistaken, and so the aspect that it superimposes is false.

original: des na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan du gyur pa gang de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs shing sgras go bar byas pa de nyid pha rol tu phyin pa med pa yin gyi /
analyzed: des na shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan du gyur pa gang de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs shing sgras go bar byas pa de nyid pha rol tu phyin pa med pa yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, the perfection of wisdom that is a conceptual representation is what the TathƒÅgata taught and made known through words. That is not the perfection.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i shes rab ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i shes rab ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not the wisdom of the TathƒÅgata.

original: de ni bden pa'i kun rdzob tu shes bya'i pa rol tu son pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni bden pa'i kun rdzob tu shes bya'i pa rol tu son pa'i phyir ro //

original: de lta ma yin na bcom ldan 'das thams cad mkhyen par ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na bcom ldan 'das thams cad mkhyen par ji ltar 'gyur /

analyzed: rtogs par byed pa 'khrul pas de dang rnam par rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan du gyur pa tha dad par khong du mi chud pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one does not understand that the representation that is a conceptualization is different from the realization that is mistaken.

original: des shes pa'i ngo bor don dam pa'i shes rab de nyid de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: des shes pa'i ngo bor don dam pa'i shes rab de nyid de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs zhes bya'o //
translated: That ultimate wisdom, which is the nature of knowledge, is said to be taught by the TathƒÅgata.

original: des na de ltar bstan pa la 'gal ba med do snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: des na de ltar bstan pa la 'gal ba med do snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: Thus, it is thought that there is no contradiction in teaching in that way.

original: yang na de bzhin gshegs pa'i shes rab gang yin pa rtogs par byed pa'i ngo bor de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa de nyid don dam par med pa kho na ste /
analyzed: yang na de bzhin gshegs pa'i shes rab gang yin pa rtogs par byed pa'i ngo bor de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa de nyid don dam par med pa kho na ste /
translated: Or, that which is the wisdom of the TathƒÅgata, which is the nature of realization, is said to be taught by the TathƒÅgata, and that itself is ultimately non-existent.

original: de don dam par na pha rol tu 'gro ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de don dam par na pha rol tu 'gro ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because ultimately, it does not go to the other shore.

original: nyid ces bya ba'i sgra ni pha rol tu phyin pa med ces bya ba'i 'og tu gzhag par blta'o //
analyzed: nyid ces bya ba'i sgra ni pha rol tu phyin pa med ces bya ba'i 'og tu gzhag par blta'o //
translated: The word itself should be seen as placed after the perfection does not exist.

original: 'dis ni don dam par rnam par 'jog cing de la rnal 'byor du snyoms par 'jug pas ji ltar bsgrub par bya ba yongs su bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni don dam par rnam par 'jog cing de la rnal 'byor du snyoms par 'jug pas ji ltar bsgrub par bya ba yongs su bstan to //
translated: This shows how to practice by establishing the ultimate and engaging in yoga with it.

original: ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan gyi rang gi ngo bo kho na la phyi rol tu sgro btags nas bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs kyi /
analyzed: ji ltar shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan gyi rang gi ngo bo kho na la phyi rol tu sgro btags nas bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs kyi /
translated: Just as the Lord spoke of the perfection of wisdom as the external reification of the very nature of the conceptual image of wisdom,üîΩso the present passage shows that the Tathagata spoke of all dharmas in the same way.

original: gzhan du ni ma yin pa de bzhin chos thams cad kyang de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs par bstan pa'i phyir rab 'byor 'di ci snyam du sems zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: gzhan du ni ma yin pa de bzhin chos thams cad kyang de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs par bstan pa'i phyir rab 'byor 'di ci snyam du sems zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: To demonstrate this, the Lord asks Subhuti, What do you think, Subhuti?

original: don dam par chos thams cad grub pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don dam par chos thams cad grub pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because ultimately all dharmas are not established.

original: grub tu chud na yang rang gi mtshan nyid rnams ni thun mong ma yin pas brda gdags mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: grub tu chud na yang rang gi mtshan nyid rnams ni thun mong ma yin pas brda gdags mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Even if they were established, because their own characteristics are not common, they cannot be designated.

original: spyi'i mtshan nyid ni btags pa'i phyir ro //üîΩrang gi mtshan @235a * //
analyzed: spyi'i mtshan nyid ni btags pa'i phyir ro // rang gi mtshan @235a * //
translated: The general characteristic is a designation.

original: nyid dang spyi'i mtshan nyid las ma gtogs par brjod par bya ba gzhan ni med de /
analyzed: nyid dang spyi'i mtshan nyid las ma gtogs par brjod par bya ba gzhan ni med de /
translated: Apart from the own characteristic and the general characteristic, there is no other object of expression.

analyzed: de gnyis phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
