original: de lta bas na don dam par gang de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i chos de gang yang med par dgongs pa'i gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i chos de gang yang ma mchis so zhes gsol to //
analyzed: de lta bas na don dam par gang de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i chos de gang yang med par dgongs pa'i gnas brtan rab 'byor gyis bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i chos de gang yang ma mchis so zhes gsol to //
translated: Therefore, the Elder Subh≈´ti, who is intent on the fact that ultimately there is no dharma whatsoever that the TathƒÅgata has taught, says, ‚ÄúBlessed One, there is no dharma whatsoever that the TathƒÅgata has taught.‚Äù

original: 'dis ni rnam par g-yeng ba tshar bcad pa dang / zab pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni rnam par g-yeng ba tshar bcad pa dang / zab pa bstan to //
translated: Here, he teaches the elimination of distraction and profundity.

original: de ltar chos thams cad la bdag med par rgya cher bstan du zin kyang las dang po pa gang dag 'di snyam du ji ltar chos thams cad bdag med par bsgom snyam sems pa de dag dngos po'i mtshan ma zil gyis gnon pa la thabs mi mkhas pa
analyzed: de ltar chos thams cad la bdag med par rgya cher bstan du zin kyang las dang po pa gang dag 'di snyam du ji ltar chos thams cad bdag med par bsgom snyam sems pa de dag dngos po'i mtshan ma zil gyis gnon pa la thabs mi mkhas pa
translated: Although it has been extensively taught that all phenomena are selfless in this way, there are beginners who think, ‚ÄúHow should I meditate on all phenomena as selfless?‚Äù They are unskilled in the method for overcoming the signs of entities.

original: dang dbral ba'i phyir gnas bcu pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: dang dbral ba'i phyir gnas bcu pa'i dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: In order to separate them from that, in the tenth chapter,

analyzed: rab 'byor 'di ji snyam du sems zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: it says, ‚ÄúSubh≈´ti, what do you think?‚Äù and so on.

analyzed: 'di la thabs rnam pa gnyis kyis gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin dang bral bar khong du chud pas chos thams cad bdag med par bsgom par bya'o zhes ston to //
translated: Here, it is taught that one should meditate on the selflessness of all phenomena by understanding the lack of a nature of oneness and manyness through two methods.

original: de la thabs rnam pa gnyis ni bsab par bya ba'i thabs dang / snang ba med par bya ba'i thabs so //
analyzed: de la thabs rnam pa gnyis ni bsab par bya ba'i thabs dang / snang ba med par bya ba'i thabs so //
translated: The two methods are the method of reduction and the method of non-appearance.

original: de la sna'i rdul ji snyed yod pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni gcig pu'i rang bzhin dang bral bar khong du chud na bsrab par bya ba'i thabs yin par ston te /
analyzed: de la sna'i rdul ji snyed yod pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni gcig pu'i rang bzhin dang bral bar khong du chud na bsrab par bya ba'i thabs yin par ston te /
translated: Here, as many atoms as there are in this world-system teaches the method of reduction, understanding the lack of a nature of oneness.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams 'di ni gcig pur rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams 'di ni gcig pur rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: This world-system is not reasonable as a single [entity],

original: bsgribs pa dang ma bsgribs pa la sogs pa gsal ba'i chos dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //üîΩdes na du mar bshig na rdul phra rab bshig par khas blang bar bya'o//
analyzed: bsgribs pa dang ma bsgribs pa la sogs pa gsal ba'i chos dang ldan pa'i phyir ro // des na du mar bshig na rdul phra rab bshig par khas blang bar bya'o//
translated: because it possesses phenomena of clarity such as obscured and unobscured [parts].üîΩTherefore, when it is destroyed as many, one should accept the destruction of the subtle particles.

analyzed: de'i phyir rdul phra rab tu bsgom na gcig pu nyid du spong bar 'gyur ro zhes ston to //

translated: Because they are interested in such a thing that generates vast merit, which is difficult for base people to have faith in, and because they are interested in the very profound selflessness of persons and of phenomena, those who understand the selflessness of persons, such as myself, are amazed by them.

original: yang dag par 'du shes zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: yang dag par 'du shes zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúhaving the right idea‚Äù means

original: don phyin ci ma log par 'du shes pa la bya'i sgra ji bzhin du mngon par zhen nas 'di ni yang dag pa'o snyam du 'du shes pa la ni mi bya'o //
analyzed: don phyin ci ma log par 'du shes pa la bya'i sgra ji bzhin du mngon par zhen nas 'di ni yang dag pa'o snyam du 'du shes pa la ni mi bya'o //
translated: that one should have the idea that the meaning is not erroneous, but one should not have the idea that it is the right idea, thinking that it is just as it is expressed in the words.

original: 'di ltar 'dir chos thams cad rang bzhin med pa don dam pa la dgongs nas bstan gyi kun rdzob tu ni rang bzhin med pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'dir chos thams cad rang bzhin med pa don dam pa la dgongs nas bstan gyi kun rdzob tu ni rang bzhin med pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because here the teaching is given with the intention of the ultimate, which is the absence of intrinsic nature of all phenomena, but it is not the case that the conventional is without intrinsic nature.

original: des na mthong ba la sogs pa dang 'gal ba ma yin no snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: des na mthong ba la sogs pa dang 'gal ba ma yin no snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is not contradictory to what is seen and so on.

original: gal te yang dag par 'du shes pa yod pa na 'du shes yod par bya ba yang don dam par yod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te yang dag par 'du shes pa yod pa na 'du shes yod par bya ba yang don dam par yod par 'gyur te /
translated: If there were a real perception, then perception would exist ultimately,

original: 'du shes par bya ba med na 'du shes kyang med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'du shes par bya ba med na 'du shes kyang med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because if there were no object of perception, then perception would not exist.

original: de'i phyir chos thams cad don dam par rang bzhin med par ji ltar 'grub snyam du sems pa'i klan ka la brtags nas /
analyzed: de'i phyir chos thams cad don dam par rang bzhin med par ji ltar 'grub snyam du sems pa'i klan ka la brtags nas /
translated: Therefore, after considering the objection that one might think, ‚ÄúHow can all phenomena be ultimately essenceless?‚Äù

original: de ci'i slad du zhes bya ba gsol te /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhes bya ba gsol te /
translated: he asks, ‚ÄúWhy is that?‚Äù

original: lan du bcom ldan 'das yang dag par 'du shes pa gang lags pa zhes bya ba gsol to //
analyzed: lan du bcom ldan 'das yang dag par 'du shes pa gang lags pa zhes bya ba gsol to //
translated: In response, he says, ‚ÄúBhagavan, that which is a real perception . . . ‚Äù

original: 'du shes par bya ba dang / gang yang med pa dang / gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin dang bral ba'i phyir don dam par de nyid 'du shes med pa ste /
analyzed: 'du shes par bya ba dang / gang yang med pa dang / gcig dang du ma'i rang bzhin dang bral ba'i phyir don dam par de nyid 'du shes med pa ste /
translated: Since the object of perception and the subject that perceives it do not exist, ultimately they are nonperceptions, because they are devoid of the nature of being one or different.

original: de'i phyir yang dag par 'du shes pa de la yang dag par 'du shes par mi bya'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de'i phyir yang dag par 'du shes pa de la yang dag par 'du shes par mi bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: Therefore, it is taught that ‚Äúone should not perceive that real perception as real.‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir ma brtags na dga' ba tsam du yod pa de'i phyir de yang dag par 'du shes zhes de bzhin gshegs pa gsung ngo //
analyzed: gang gi phyir ma brtags na dga' ba tsam du yod pa de'i phyir de yang dag par 'du shes zhes de bzhin gshegs pa gsung ngo //
translated: Because it exists as mere pleasure when not examined, therefore the TathƒÅgata says it is a correct perception.

original: de lta ma yin na rnam pa thams cad du med pa'i phyir gsung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na rnam pa thams cad du med pa'i phyir gsung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, it would not be mentioned because it would be non-existent in every way.

original: 'dis ni don dam par rnam par 'jog cing ji ltar rnal 'byor du snyoms par 'jug pas bsgrub par bya ba dang / ji ltar rnam par g-yeng ba tshar gcad par bya ba @237b de gnyi ga bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni don dam par rnam par 'jog cing ji ltar rnal 'byor du snyoms par 'jug pas bsgrub par bya ba dang / ji ltar rnam par g-yeng ba tshar gcad par bya ba @237b de gnyi ga bstan to //
translated: This shows both how it is established by ultimate establishment and how it is to be accomplished by meditative equipoise, and how distraction is to be eliminated.

original: zab pa yang brjod do //
analyzed: zab pa yang brjod do //
translated: It also expresses profundity.

original: sgro 'dogs pa dang skur pa 'debs pa'i mtha' yang spangs so //
analyzed: sgro 'dogs pa dang skur pa 'debs pa'i mtha' yang spangs so //
translated: And it avoids the extremes of superimposition and denial.üîΩIn order to generate amazement in those very lazy ones, it is said:

original: le lo can de dag nyid ngo mtshar ba bskyed pa'i phyir bdag chos kyi rnam grangs 'di bshad pa la rtog cing mos pa ni bdag la ngo mtshar ma lags kyi /
analyzed: le lo can de dag nyid ngo mtshar ba bskyed pa'i phyir bdag chos kyi rnam grangs 'di bshad pa la rtog cing mos pa ni bdag la ngo mtshar ma lags kyi /
translated: It is not amazing to me that I conceive of and aspire to explain this Dharma teaching.

original: bcom ldan 'das slad ma'i tshe slad ma'i dus lnga brgya pa tha ma la sems can gang dag chos kyi rnam grangs 'di len pa dang / 'dzin pa dang / kun chub par bgyid pa de dag ni ngo mtshar rab dang ldan par 'gyur lags so zhes bya ba gsol to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das slad ma'i tshe slad ma'i dus lnga brgya pa tha ma la sems can gang dag chos kyi rnam grangs 'di len pa dang / 'dzin pa dang / kun chub par bgyid pa de dag ni ngo mtshar rab dang ldan par 'gyur lags so zhes bya ba gsol to //
translated: who will hold it, and who will master it will be most wondrous indeed.

original: 'di'i phyir bsdu ba'i don 'di yin te ma 'ongs pa na dam pa'i chos rab tu rnam par 'jig par 'gyur ba'i dus na byang chub sems dpa' gang dag chos kyi rnam grangs 'di 'dzin par 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'di'i phyir bsdu ba'i don 'di yin te ma 'ongs pa na dam pa'i chos rab tu rnam par 'jig par 'gyur ba'i dus na byang chub sems dpa' gang dag chos kyi rnam grangs 'di 'dzin par 'gyur la /
translated: The meaning of this summary is as follows: In the future, at the time when the true Dharma is completely destroyed, there will be bodhisattvas who will hold this Dharma teaching.

original: de dag gang zag la sogs par 'dzin par mi 'gyur ba de lta bu dag kyang 'byung bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: de dag gang zag la sogs par 'dzin par mi 'gyur ba de lta bu dag kyang 'byung bar 'gyur na /
translated: And they will not hold it as a person and so forth.

original: khyed cag dam pa'i chos kyi dga' ston dang bcas pa'i dus na yang sgrub pa de 'dra ba med pas na 'di ni khyed kyi shin tu ngo tsha ba'i gnas yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: khyed cag dam pa'i chos kyi dga' ston dang bcas pa'i dus na yang sgrub pa de 'dra ba med pas na 'di ni khyed kyi shin tu ngo tsha ba'i gnas yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Since you do not have such practice even at the time of the feast of the true Dharma, this is a source of great shame for you.

original: de la bdag ces bya ba ni gang zag la bdag med par rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la bdag ces bya ba ni gang zag la bdag med par rtogs pa'o //
translated: Here, self is the realization of the selflessness of persons.

original: 'di zhes bya ba ni gang zag dang chos la bdag med par yongs su ston pa'o //
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba ni gang zag dang chos la bdag med par yongs su ston pa'o //
translated: The this refers to the teaching of the selflessness of persons and phenomena.

original: bshad pa la zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyis mngon sum du gsal bar mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: bshad pa la zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyis mngon sum du gsal bar mdzad pa'o //
translated: The explanation is the clear manifestation by the Blessed One.

original: rtog pa zhes bya ba ni dang ba'i rnam pa ste dang bar ston to //
analyzed: rtog pa zhes bya ba ni dang ba'i rnam pa ste dang bar ston to //
translated: The conception is the aspect of clarity; it shows clarity.

original: mos pa zhes bya ba ni yid ches pa'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: mos pa zhes bya ba ni yid ches pa'i rnam pa'o //
translated: The aspiration is the aspect of confidence.

original: sems can de dag ces bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das bskal pa ma 'ongs pa'i dus na 'byung ba dag go //
analyzed: sems can de dag ces bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das bskal pa ma 'ongs pa'i dus na 'byung ba dag go //
translated: The beings are those who will appear in the future Blessed One.

original: 'dir len pa la sogs pa'i tshig smos pa gang yin pa de ni sngar bshad par zad do //
analyzed: 'dir len pa la sogs pa'i tshig smos pa gang yin pa de ni sngar bshad par zad do //
translated: Here, the words grasping and so on have already been explained above.

original: de ni 'di skad du bstan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ni 'di skad du bstan par 'gyur te /
translated: This is taught as follows:

original: gang zag la bdag med pa tsam rtogs pa bdag bcom ldan 'das las mngon sum du thos pa'i stobs kyis bdag med pa gnyis kyi tshul ston par byed pa'i chos 'di lta bu la dad cing yid ches pa tsam du gyur pa gang yin pa de ngo mtsharüîΩma yin gyi /

translated: It is not surprising that those who have merely gained faith in and confidence in this Dharma teaching that reveals the way of the two kinds of no self, through the power of having directly heard the Bhagavat teach the mere realization of the individual no self.

original: gang bcom ldan 'das bskal pa na 'di la 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis chos kyi rnam grangs 'di lta bu rtogs nas kun chub par byed pa de dag ngo mtshar rab dang ldan par 'gyur te /üîΩbcom ldan 'das dang bskal pa theg pa chen po spong ba mang ba na de la dad pa @238a * //
analyzed: gang bcom ldan 'das bskal pa na 'di la 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis chos kyi rnam grangs 'di lta bu rtogs nas kun chub par byed pa de dag ngo mtshar rab dang ldan par 'gyur te / bcom ldan 'das dang bskal pa theg pa chen po spong ba mang ba na de la dad pa @238a * //
translated: But those who, in this degenerate age, understand and master this Dharma teaching through the stages of retention and so on, they are truly amazing.

original: skyes pa ni shin tu dkon pa'i phyir ro snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: skyes pa ni shin tu dkon pa'i phyir ro snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: For, the Bhagavat thought, it is very rare for anyone to have faith in the Mahayana when it is being abandoned.

original: 'dis ni le lo spangs te dam pa'i chos gzung ba la sogs pa la 'dun pa dang / smon lam gyis gnas par bya ba bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni le lo spangs te dam pa'i chos gzung ba la sogs pa la 'dun pa dang / smon lam gyis gnas par bya ba bstan pa yin no //
translated: This shows that one should be zealous in retaining the holy Dharma and so on, and should persevere in it through aspiration and prayer.

original: de dag lung 'ba' zhig dang ldan par 'gyur bar ma zad kyi rtogs pa phun sum tshogs par yang bstan pa'i phyir yang bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba gsol to //
analyzed: de dag lung 'ba' zhig dang ldan par 'gyur bar ma zad kyi rtogs pa phun sum tshogs par yang bstan pa'i phyir yang bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba gsol to //
translated: Not only are they endowed with scripture, but they are also shown to be endowed with realization.

original: bdag ces bya ba la sogs pa smos pa ni mtshon pa ste /
analyzed: bdag ces bya ba la sogs pa smos pa ni mtshon pa ste /
translated: The words ‚Äúself‚Äù and so on are mentioned as examples.

original: de na de dag chos su 'du shes 'jug par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de na de dag chos su 'du shes 'jug par mi 'gyur te /
translated: There, they do not engage in the perception of phenomena,

original: bdag med pa gnyi ga cig car rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag med pa gnyi ga cig car rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they simultaneously realize both kinds of selflessness.

original: gal te bdag med pa la sogs pa yod na ni de'i tshe nges par de 'du shes pa yang 'jug go snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: gal te bdag med pa la sogs pa yod na ni de'i tshe nges par de 'du shes pa yang 'jug go snyam du sems pa la /
translated: If selflessness and so on exist, then at that time, the perception of that definitely engages.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes gsol nas /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes gsol nas /
translated: If one thinks this, then in response to ‚ÄúWhy is that?‚Äù

original: lan du bdag tu 'du shes pa zhes bya ba gsol to //
analyzed: lan du bdag tu 'du shes pa zhes bya ba gsol to //
translated: the answer is ‚ÄúThe perception of self.‚Äù

original: 'dis ni bdag la sogs pa ji skad smos pa ltar re zhig zhog gang 'di ni nga'o snyam du bdag tu 'du shes pa skye bo thams cad la grags pa de yang brtags pa'i khur mi bzod pas ci yang ma yin na bdag la sogs pa myong ba
analyzed: 'dis ni bdag la sogs pa ji skad smos pa ltar re zhig zhog gang 'di ni nga'o snyam du bdag tu 'du shes pa skye bo thams cad la grags pa de yang brtags pa'i khur mi bzod pas ci yang ma yin na bdag la sogs pa myong ba
translated: This shows that the self and so on should be set aside for the time being as they have been mentioned.

original: med pa dngos po yod par mi 'gyur ba lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes de skad ston te /
analyzed: med pa dngos po yod par mi 'gyur ba lta smos kyang ci dgos zhes de skad ston te /
translated: Since the self that is renowned to all beings as the basis for the thought I am this is not anything at all, it cannot bear the burden of analysis, what need is there to mention that the self and so on do not exist without the experience of the aggregates?

original: 'dis ni rnal 'byor du snyoms par 'jug pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni rnal 'byor du snyoms par 'jug pa bstan to //
translated: This teaches the yoga of equipoise.

original: gal te bdag la sogs pa med du zin kyang de dag tu phyin ci log tu gyur nas /üîΩbdag la sogs par 'du shes 'jug par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ci mngon snyam du sems pa'i dri ba nang du brjod pa bzhag pa la brtags nas /
analyzed: gal te bdag la sogs pa med du zin kyang de dag tu phyin ci log tu gyur nas / bdag la sogs par 'du shes 'jug par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ci mngon snyam du sems pa'i dri ba nang du brjod pa bzhag pa la brtags nas /
translated: If the self and so on do not exist, then the misconception of them would not occur.

original: de ci'i slad du zhes gsol te /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhes gsol te /
translated: What is the reason for this?

analyzed: lan du sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni 'du shes thams cad dang bral ba'i slad du'o zhes bya ba gsol to //

original: 'di la don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'di la don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning is as follows.

analyzed: dngos po ma lus par de kho na ji lta ba bzhin du thugs su chud pas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams zhes bya'o //

translated: Therein, the object of continuous suffering, etc. is that which is stated as ‚Äúfor five hundred lifetimes.‚Äù

original: 'dis ni 'di'i rgya che ba brjod do //
analyzed: 'dis ni 'di'i rgya che ba brjod do //

original: mi bzad pa'i sdug bsngal la sogs pa yul ni yan lag dang nying lag rnams zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: mi bzad pa'i sdug bsngal la sogs pa yul ni yan lag dang nying lag rnams zhes gang gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The object of unbearable suffering, etc. is that which is stated as ‚Äúmy major and minor body parts.‚Äù

original: mi bzod pa'i gzhi ni sdug bsngal rnam pa gsum 'di lta ste 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal dang sems can log par 'jug pa'i sdug bsngal dang / longs spyod dang mi ldan pa'i sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: mi bzod pa'i gzhi ni sdug bsngal rnam pa gsum 'di lta ste 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal dang sems can log par 'jug pa'i sdug bsngal dang / longs spyod dang mi ldan pa'i sdug bsngal lo //
translated: The basis of non-forbearance is the three kinds of suffering: the suffering of the life-cycle, the suffering of the wrong-doing of sentient beings, and the suffering of the lack of resources.

original: de la mi bzod pa'i gzhi dang po'i gnyen por de lta bas na zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: de la mi bzod pa'i gzhi dang po'i gnyen por de lta bas na zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: The antidote to the first basis of non-forbearance is stated in the words, ‚ÄúTherefore, etc.‚Äù

original: 'di mtha' dag gis ni mi bzod pa spangs te /
analyzed: 'di mtha' dag gis ni mi bzod pa spangs te /
translated: The whole of this passage teaches that one should abandon non-forbearance,

original: byang chub la 'dun pa dang smon lam gyis gnas par bya'o zhes bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: byang chub la 'dun pa dang smon lam gyis gnas par bya'o zhes bstan pa yin te /
translated: and should abide in the aspiration for enlightenment.

original: byang chub tu sems bskyed na su yang 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal gyis reg par mi 'gyur ro snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub tu sems bskyed na su yang 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal gyis reg par mi 'gyur ro snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: The idea is that if one generates the Thought of Enlightenment, no one will be touched by the suffering of the life-cycle.

original: brgya la byang chub kyi sems lan 'ga' zhig bskyed du zin kyang bdag tu mngon par zhen pa'i sgo nas sdug bsngal rnam pa gsum gyi 'du shes kyis skrag nas yang skyed par mi byed pas 'du shes thams cad rnam par spangs te zhes bya ba gsungs te
analyzed: brgya la byang chub kyi sems lan 'ga' zhig bskyed du zin kyang bdag tu mngon par zhen pa'i sgo nas sdug bsngal rnam pa gsum gyi 'du shes kyis skrag nas yang skyed par mi byed pas 'du shes thams cad rnam par spangs te zhes bya ba gsungs te
translated: Even if one generates the Thought of Enlightenment a few times, one does not generate it again out of fear of the three kinds of suffering, by way of manifest clinging to a self. Therefore, it says, ‚Äúhaving abandoned all notions.‚Äù

original: // bdag la sogs par 'du shes pa dang / sdug bsngal rnam pa gsum gyi 'du shes ni 'dir 'du shes thams cad do //
analyzed: // bdag la sogs par 'du shes pa dang / sdug bsngal rnam pa gsum gyi 'du shes ni 'dir 'du shes thams cad do //
translated: Here, all notions are the notions of a self, etc., and the notions of the three kinds of suffering.

original: gzugs la sogs pa mngon par zhen pa ni nyan thos la sogs pa bzhin du 'khor ba yongs su brtags nas sdug bsngal des yid gdungs nas brgya lam na yang byang chub kyi sems mi bskyed pas gzugs la mi gnas par zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa mngon par zhen pa ni nyan thos la sogs pa bzhin du 'khor ba yongs su brtags nas sdug bsngal des yid gdungs nas brgya lam na yang byang chub kyi sems mi bskyed pas gzugs la mi gnas par zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs
translated: Clinging to form, etc., is like the Sravakas, etc., who, having investigated Samsara, are distressed by that suffering and do not generate the Thought of Enlightenment even once in a hundred years. Therefore, it says, ‚Äúnot dwelling in form, etc.‚Äù

original: so // gzugs la sogs pa la yong bar mngon par zhen pa ni de la gnas pa ste /
analyzed: so // gzugs la sogs pa la yong bar mngon par zhen pa ni de la gnas pa ste /
translated: Dwelling in form, etc., is clinging to form, etc., as real.

original: 'dir yang snga ma bzhin du bshad do //
analyzed: 'dir yang snga ma bzhin du bshad do //
translated: Here, too, it is explained as above.

original: 'dir tshig zlos par yang mi 'gyur te //
analyzed: 'dir tshig zlos par yang mi 'gyur te //
translated: Here, there is no repetition of words,

original: 'dis ni mi bzod pa'i gzhi'i gnyen po brjod do //
analyzed: 'dis ni mi bzod pa'i gzhi'i gnyen po brjod do //
translated: for this is the antidote to the basis of intolerance.

original: snga mas ni pha rol tu phyin pa la sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: snga mas ni pha rol tu phyin pa la sbyor ba'o //
translated: The former verse enjoins the practice of the transcendences,

original: 'dir gdul ba rnams chos med pa la yang mi gnas pa zhes bya ba lhag ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dir gdul ba rnams chos med pa la yang mi gnas pa zhes bya ba lhag ma yin te /
translated: and here the disciples do not stand even in the absence of phenomena.

original: 'dis ni med pa la mngon par zhen pa dgag go //
analyzed: 'dis ni med pa la mngon par zhen pa dgag go //
translated: This verse rejects the notion that nothing exists.

original: ci la yang mi gnas par zhes bya ba 'dis ni gzugs la sogs pa dag la ming tsam du yod par mngon pa zhen pa dgag ste /
analyzed: ci la yang mi gnas par zhes bya ba 'dis ni gzugs la sogs pa dag la ming tsam du yod par mngon pa zhen pa dgag ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúdo not stand anywhere‚Äù rejects the notion that form, etc. exist only as names.

original: 'dis ni rnal 'byor du snyoms par 'jug pa bstan to //üîΩci gzugs @241a * //
analyzed: 'dis ni rnal 'byor du snyoms par 'jug pa bstan to // ci gzugs @241a * //
translated: This verse teaches the yoga of meditative concentration.

original: la sogs pa yod bzhin du de la gnas pa la zhe sdang ba'i phyir ram /
analyzed: la sogs pa yod bzhin du de la gnas pa la zhe sdang ba'i phyir ram /
translated: Do you ask, ‚ÄúIf form, etc. exist, why is it said that the bodhisattva does not stand in form, etc.?

original: 'on te med pa kho na la log par mngon par zhen pa yongs su spang pa'i don du dgag snyam du sems pa'i 'dri ba la brtags nas de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes zhus pa dang / lan du gnas pa gang yin pa de nyid mi gnas pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: 'on te med pa kho na la log par mngon par zhen pa yongs su spang pa'i don du dgag snyam du sems pa'i 'dri ba la brtags nas de ci'i slad du zhe na zhes zhus pa dang / lan du gnas pa gang yin pa de nyid mi gnas pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: But if you think, It is in order to completely abandon attachment to non-existence, then, having examined the question, you ask, Why is that? and the answer is given, Because that which abides does not abide.

original: 'di la don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'di la don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning here is this:

analyzed: khyed kyi sems thog ma med pa'i dus nas gzugs la sogs pa la dngos por mngon par zhen pa'i stobs kyis gzugs la sogs pa la gnas te /
translated: From beginningless time, your mind has abided in form and so on due to the power of attachment to things like form.

original: bden par mngon par zhen pa gang yin pa de gzugs la sogs pa dngos po gang yin pa med pa'i phyir don dam par mi gnas pa'o //
analyzed: bden par mngon par zhen pa gang yin pa de gzugs la sogs pa dngos po gang yin pa med pa'i phyir don dam par mi gnas pa'o //
translated: That attachment to true existence does not abide ultimately because the things, such as form, that it clings to as truly existent do not exist.

original: de bas na zhes bya ba mjug bsdu ba 'dis ni 'dir phyogs gnyis pa la gnas par ston te /
analyzed: de bas na zhes bya ba mjug bsdu ba 'dis ni 'dir phyogs gnyis pa la gnas par ston te /
translated: Thus, this concluding statement shows that here, in the second position, abiding is taught.

original: sbyin pa'i sgras snga ma bzhin du 'dir yang pha rol tu phyin pa drug car du bzhed do //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i sgras snga ma bzhin du 'dir yang pha rol tu phyin pa drug car du bzhed do //

analyzed: mi bzod pa'i gzhi gnyis pa'i gnyen por yang rab 'byor zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: To remedy the second basis of impatience, the Lord says, ‚ÄúSubhuti, if a Bodhisattva, etc.‚Äù

original: 'di mtha' dag gis ci gal te byang chub sems dpa'i su'i don du pha rol tu phyin pa shin tu bya dka' ba la sbyor ba rtsom par spro yang sems can de dag kyang don dam par med la sems can du 'du shes pa yang don dam par
analyzed: 'di mtha' dag gis ci gal te byang chub sems dpa'i su'i don du pha rol tu phyin pa shin tu bya dka' ba la sbyor ba rtsom par spro yang sems can de dag kyang don dam par med la sems can du 'du shes pa yang don dam par
translated: All of this shows that if a Bodhisattva is willing to undertake the practice of the difficult perfections for the sake of sentient beings, and if those sentient beings do not exist ultimately, and the notion of sentient being does not exist ultimately,

analyzed: med na de dag ji ltar sems can de lta bu dag log par 'jug pas skyo bar 'gyur zhes de skad yongs su ston to //
translated: how can he become weary of engaging in those sentient beings, as if he were engaging in an error?

original: sems can dang der 'du shes pa bkag pas ni bdag med pa gnyis ka brjod do //
analyzed: sems can dang der 'du shes pa bkag pas ni bdag med pa gnyis ka brjod do //

original: sems can thams cad kyi don gyi phyir zhes bya ba 'dis ni 'dir rgya che ba bstan to //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi don gyi phyir zhes bya ba 'dis ni 'dir rgya che ba bstan to //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúfor the sake of all sentient beings‚Äù shows the magnanimity here.

original: lhag ma mtha' dag gis zab pa bstan to //
analyzed: lhag ma mtha' dag gis zab pa bstan to //

original: de ltar re zhig rigs pas bzod par rigs so zhes bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar re zhig rigs pas bzod par rigs so zhes bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having shown that it is reasonable to be patient,

analyzed: da ni de bzhin gshegs pa la yid ches pas kyang rigs so zhes bstan pa'i phyir yang dag par gsungs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Now, in order to teach that it is also reasonable to have confidence in the TathƒÅgata, he says ‚Äúthe one who speaks the truth,‚Äù etc.

original: dang po ni bstan pa'o //
analyzed: dang po ni bstan pa'o //
translated: The first is the teaching.

original: lhag ma ni bshad pa'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni bshad pa'o //
translated: The rest is the explanation.

original: yang na bden pa bzhi bstan pa'o //
analyzed: yang na bden pa bzhi bstan pa'o //

original: go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //

original: yang na yang dag pa gsungs pa zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba bstan to //
analyzed: yang na yang dag pa gsungs pa zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba bstan to //

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs bstan pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThe TathƒÅgata‚Äù teaches the probative reason.

original: 'di ltar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das dag nyon @241b mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs te /
analyzed: 'di ltar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das dag nyon @241b mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs te /
translated: Thus, the Blessed Buddhas have abandoned the obscurations of the afflictions and the obscurations to knowing.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa de bzhin du 'di yang gshegs te byon pas de bzhin gshegs pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa de bzhin du 'di yang gshegs te byon pas de bzhin gshegs pa'o //
translated: The TathƒÅgata has gone thus, and this one has also gone in the same way, therefore he is the TathƒÅgata.

analyzed: de bas na yang dag pa phyin ci ma log par gsung ba ste /

analyzed: 'di de bzhin gshegs pa kho na yin par ji ltar 'grub snyam pa dang / bden pa gsung pa zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúhe is the one who speaks the truth‚Äù is stated.

analyzed: bden pa ste 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi'i mtshan nyid gsung ba'i ngang tshul can gang yin pa ste /
translated: He is the one who has the nature of speaking the truth, that is, the truth of the four noble truths.

original: des na de de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya bar nges so //
analyzed: des na de de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya bar nges so //
translated: Therefore, he is ascertained to be the TathƒÅgata.

analyzed: shin tu skol ba'i don ni rnam pa thams cad du yang dag par ston mi srid de /

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /

analyzed: thabs las byung dang de yi rgyu // lkog gyur de bshad shin tu dka' //

analyzed: zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //

analyzed: de spang bar bya ba dang blang bar bya ba'i de kho na thabs bcas par ji ltar gnas pa bzhin du gsung pa ste /

analyzed: log par gsung pa ma yin no zhes bya ba gsungs pa'o //

analyzed: 'di mtha' dag gis ni 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs kyis bcom ldan 'das tshad mar bsgrubs so //
translated: This entire passage establishes the BhagavƒÅn as a valid person by means of a consequential argument.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /

analyzed: skyob las yang dag bstan ma lus //

original: ces bshad do //

translated: If the BhagavƒÅn said the five aggregates are like an illusion, how could they be the truth of suffering, which is their nature?

analyzed: ba'i phyir de kun tu 'byung bdag 'gog pa dag kyang med pa kho na ste /
translated: Because suffering is ultimately false, its origin and cessation also do not exist.

analyzed: ri bong gi rva la sogs pa shin tu med pa la ni de gnyis mi srid do //

analyzed: bgrod par bya ba med na 'gro ba yang med do //

original: 'di skad du /üîΩbyang chub bzhags nas bden pa gcig grub par /
analyzed: 'di skad du / byang chub bzhags nas bden pa gcig grub par /
translated: As it is said:üîΩIf, having attained enlightenment,

analyzed: gzigs pa med na bzhir lta ga la 'gyur //

analyzed: zhes bstan pa lta bu'o //

translated: Having examined that, in order to eliminate the extreme of superimposition for those who conceive of the speaker of the truth literally, he says ‚ÄúSubh≈´ti, it is thus.

analyzed: bden pa yang med ces bya ba ni don dam par rang bzhin gang yang grub pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: There is no truth‚Äù means that ultimately no nature at all is established.

original: brdzun pa yang med ces bya ba la /

translated: ‚ÄúThere is no falsity‚Äù means

analyzed: mtha' gnyis bkag pa 'dis ni dbu ma'i lam nyid du ston to //

original: nyan thos rnams kyis bdag tu mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir gang zag la bdag med pa tsam gyi cha shas kyis bden pa bzhi po dag bstan gyi /

translated: It is like the case of a man who, etc.üîΩThose who are attached to the things that are the nature of the body, existence, and enjoyments, and give gifts while striving for them, fall into that.

analyzed: phyin ci log gi dngos po sdug bsngal mtha' dag gi gnas su lhung ngo //

translated: By all of this, the mental

translated: Thus, although one is introduced to patience by this aspect, those who experience the taste of meditative concentration,üîΩand who, attached to that, do not strive for the Dharma of the Great Vehicle, the cause for filling the collection of wisdom, are deprived of the collection of wisdom.

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni thams cad mkhyen pa yin pa'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa dang / gzigs pa yin /

analyzed: nyi ma dang / 'od dang / sa dang chu la sogs pa'i gnas skabs kyi bye brag ni snga dro ste /
translated: The distinction of the conditions of the sun, light, earth, water, and so on is the morning.

original: de ltar gyur pa'i gnas skabs kyi bye brag kho na la dus zhes brtags kyi bye brag can la sogs pas yongs su brtags pa lta bu ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /

analyzed: dus kyi sgra dang de ni gzhi mthun pas bye brag tu byas so //

original: gzhan gyi bye brag gis rnam par dbye bar khas len na bye brag de nyid nyi ma la sogs pa'i gnas kyi bye brag snga dro la sogs par tha snyad gdags pa'i rgyu yin na /

original: de ni sngar bstan pa nyid do //

analyzed: de la rang dga' bas bskyed pa'i brda'i dbang gis srog chags la sogs pa'i gnas skabs kyi bye brag rnam pa de lta bu la dus zhes tha snyad btags kyi sgra dang don du 'brel pa brtags pa'i dbang gis ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir tshe
translated: In order to demonstrate that the term ‚Äútime‚Äù is a convention applied to such a state of affairs, such as the particular states of living beings, etc., which are produced by the power of conventional symbols, and not by the power of the investigation of the relation between word and object, he says:

analyzed: zhes bya ba'i sgras bye brag tu byas so //

original: brda'i yul yin pa'i phyir /

translated: This Dharma discourse
